en: British, French Foreign Ministers to Re-Invigorate DRC Peace Process - 2002-01-18
kin: Abaminisitiri b’ububanyi n’amahanga b’Ubwongereza, Ubufaransa mu kongera ingufu mu bikorwa by’amahoro bya DRC - 2002-01-18
mt0: <pad> The foreign ministers of the UK and France to strengthen the peace process in the DRC - 2002</s>

en: The British and French foreign ministers travel to the Democratic Republic of Congo Monday to kickoff a three-day, four-nation tour of the troubled region of Central Africa.
kin: Ku wa mbere, abaminisitiri b’ububanyi n’amahanga b’Ubwongereza n’Ubufaransa berekeje muri Repubulika Iharanira Demokarasi ya Kongo kugira ngo batangire urugendo rw’iminsi itatu, bazenguruka ibihugu bine by'akarere gafite ibibazo muri Afurika yo hagati.
mt0: <pad> On Monday, the foreign ministers of the UK and France arrived in the Republic of the Congo to begin a three-day tour of four troubled countries in central Africa.</s>

en: The mission will be jointly led by British Foreign Secretary Jack Straw and his French counterpart Hubert Vedrine.
kin: Ubu butumwa buzayoborwa n’umunyamabanga w’ububanyi n’amahanga w’Ubwongereza Jack Straw na mugenzi we w’Ubufaransa Hubert Vedrine.
mt0: <pad> The mission will be led by the British Foreign Secretary Jack Straw and his French counterpart Hubert Vedrine.</s>

en: They will be visiting the Democratic Republic of Congo, Rwanda, Burundi and Uganda.
kin: Bazasura Repubulika Iharanira Demokarasi ya Kongo, u Rwanda, Uburundi na Uganda.
mt0: <pad> They will visit the Republic of the Congo, Rwanda, Burundi and Uganda.</s>

en: Their primary objective is to breathe new life into the peace process in the war-torn Congo.
kin: Intego yabo y'ibanze ni uguhumeka umwuka w'ubuzima bushya mu nzira y'amahoro muri Kongo yibasiwe n'intambara.
mt0: <pad> Their main goal is to breathe a new life into the peace process in the war-ravaged Congo.</s>

en: Specifically, the British and French want to see the withdrawal of foreign troops who back the Congolese government (n Kinshasa, demobilization of rebels who occupy more than half the country, and peace talks to end the conflict.
kin: By'umwihariko, Abongereza n'Abafaransa bifuza kubona ikurwaho ry'ingabo z'amahanga zishyigikiye guverinoma ya Kongo-Kinshasa, gusezerera mu gisirikare inyeshyamba zigarurira igice cya kabiri cy'igihugu, n'ibiganiro by'amahoro kugira ngo amakimbirane arangire.
mt0: <pad> Especially, the British and French want to see the withdrawal of all foreign forces supporting the government of Congo-Kinshasa, the disarming of the rebels who occupy the second half of the country, and peace talks to end the conflict.</s>

en: British Foreign Secretary Straw said the mission also has a broader goal of making sure the Congo does not become another Afghanistan.
kin: Umunyamabanga w’ububanyi n’amahanga w’Ubwongereza Straw yavuze ko ubwo butumwa bufite intego nini yo kureba niba Kongo itazaba indi Afuganisitani.
mt0: <pad> The British foreign secretary Straw said that the mission had a big goal to see if Congo would not be the next Afghanistan.</s>

en: "The 11th of September has made it much more urgent that we take earlier action against failed, and failing states," he said.
kin: Ati: "Ku ya 11 Nzeri birihutirwa cyane ko dufata ingamba zo kurwanya ibihugu byananiranye, kandi bikinanirana".
mt0: <pad> He said: "On September 11, it is very important that we take action to fight the countries that have failed, and are refusing to cooperate."</s>

en: In Kinshasa, the ministers will meet Congolese President Joseph Kabila. He took power one year ago, after his father, President Laurent Kabila, was assassinated by one of his bodyguards.
kin: I Kinshasa, abaminisitiri bazahura na Perezida wa Kongo, Joseph Kabila. Yafashe ubutegetsi umwaka ushize, nyuma yuko se, Perezida Laurent Kabila, yishwe n'umwe mu bamurindaga.
mt0: <pad> In Kinshasa, the ministers will meet with the President of Congo, Joseph Kabila. He assumed power last year, after his father, President Laurent Kabila, was killed by one of his guards.</s>

en: Their next stop will be Kigali for talks with Rwandan President Paul Kagame, and the leader of the Rally for Congolese Democracy rebels, Adolphe Onusumba.
kin: Aho niharangira hazakurikiraho Kigali kugira ngo baganire na Perezida w’u Rwanda, Paul Kagame, n’umuyobozi w’inyeshyamba zo muri Repubulika Iharanira Demokarasi ya Kongo, Adolphe Onusumba.
mt0: <pad> Then I will go to Kigali to meet with the President of Rwanda, Paul Kagame, and the leader of the rebels in the Democratic Republic of Congo, Adolphe Onusumba.</s>

en: The ministers will make a brief visit to Burundi to discuss that country's civil war with President Pierre Buyoya.
kin: Abaminisitiri bazasura u Burundi akanya gato kugira ngo baganire ku ntambara ya gisivili yo muri icyo gihugu na Perezida Pierre Buyoya.
mt0: <pad> The ministers will visit Burundi for a short time to discuss the civil war in the country with President Pierre Buyoya.</s>

en: The tour will end in Uganda, where meetings are scheduled with President Yoweri Museveni and Jean-Pierre Bemba, who leads the Movement for the Liberation of Congo guerrillas.
kin: Uruzinduko ruzarangirira muri Uganda, aho hateganijwe inama na Perezida Yoweri Museveni na Jean-Pierre Bemba uyobora Umuryango uharanira kubohoza inyeshyamba za Kongo.
mt0: <pad> The tour will end in Uganda, where he is scheduled to meet with President Yoweri Museveni and the leader of the Congolese rebel movement Jean-Pierre Bemba.</s>

en: UNICEF Pushes for Demobilizing Child Soliders Near Africa's Great Lakes - 2002-10-07
kin: UNICEF irashyira ingufu mu kuvana abana mu gisirikare mu karere k'ibiyaga bigari bya Afurika - 2002-10-07
mt0: <pad> UNICEF aims to end child soldiers in the Southern African region - 2002</s>

en: The United Nations children's agency, UNICEF, is pushing for child soldiers to be demobilized in Africa's Great Lakes region, as several peace drives there build momentum.
kin: Ishami ry’umuryango w’abibumbye ryita ku bana, UNICEF, rirasaba ko abana b’abasirikare bavanwa mu gisirikare mu karere k’ibiyaga bigari bya Afurika, kubera ko amahoro menshi ari ho agaragarira.
mt0: <pad> UNICEF is calling for the disarming of children soldiers in the Southern African region, because peace there is a key factor in many conflicts.</s>

en: The agency says funding is in place to help the children leave the military and restart their lives.
kin: Iki kigo kivuga ko inkunga ihari yo gufasha abana kuva mu gisirikare no gutangira ubuzima bwabo.
mt0: <pad> The organization says that there is support available to help the children leave the military and start their own lives.</s>

en: UNICEF's top child protection official, Manuel Fontaine, says peace initiatives in Uganda, the Democratic Republic of Congo and Rwanda are making it possible to get more children under the age of 18 out of fighting units.
kin: Umuyobozi mukuru ushinzwe kurengera abana muri UNICEF, Manuel Fontaine, avuga ko ingamba z’amahoro muri Uganda, Repubulika Iharanira Demokarasi ya Kongo no mu Rwanda zituma bishoboka ko abana benshi bari munsi y’imyaka 18 bava mu mitwe irwana.
mt0: <pad> UNICEF's chief of protection for children, Manuel Fontaine, said that peace efforts in Uganda, the Republic of the Congo and Rwanda have helped to prevent many young children from joining the warring parties.</s>

en: "We insist that child soldiers could be demobilized, even in conflict situations.
kin: Turashimangira ko abana b'abasirikare bakwiriye kuva mu gisirikare, ndetse no mu bihe by'amakimbirane.
mt0: <pad> We reiterate that children of soldiers should be removed from the military, even in times of conflict.</s>

en: We should never wait for peace to get children out of any form of armed group.
kin: Ntidukwiye na rimwe gutegereza amahoro kugira ngo abana bavanwe mu mutwe uwo ari wo wose witwaje intwaro.
mt0: <pad> We should never wait for peace to remove children from the hands of any armed man.</s>

en: But, obviously, that's a better timing at the moment. It's more conducive to demobilization," Mr. Fontaine said.
kin: Ariko, ikigaragara ni uko iki ari igihe cyiza cyo kubikora. Bizadufasha cyane nibava mu gisirikare, Bwana Fontaine ni ko yavuze.
mt0: <pad> But, it is clear that this is a good time to do it. It will help us when we go out of the military, Mr Fontaine said.</s>

en: He says there are currently 1,200 child soldiers in Uganda, fighting mainly with the rebel Lord's Resistance Army. He says that over the past 14 years, the group has abducted some 10,000 children, boys to fight and girls to serve as sex slaves.
kin: Avuga ko muri Uganda muri iki gihe hari abasirikare 1200 b'abana, barwana ahanini n'ingabo za Lord Resistance Army. Avuga ko mu myaka 14 ishize, iryo tsinda ryashimuse abana bagera ku 10,000, abahungu bajyanwa kurwana n'ab’abakobwa kugira ngo bagirwe imbata z’imibonano mpuzabitsina.
mt0: <pad> He says that there are now 1200 child soldiers in Uganda, fighting mainly with the Lord Resistance Army. He says that in the last 14 years, the group abducted 10,000 children, boys being sent to fight and girls to be made sex slaves.</s>

en: According to UNICEF, The Democratic Republic of Congo still has some 10,000 children recruited to fight, while Rwanda has up to 2,000 children involved in combat.
kin: UNICEF ivuga ko Repubulika Iharanira Demokarasi ya Kongo igifite abana bagera ku 10,000 binjijwe mu ntambara, mu gihe u Rwanda rufite abana bagera ku 2000 bagize uruhare mu ntambara.
mt0: <pad> UNICEF says that the Republic of the Congo still has 10,000 children engaged in the war, while the Rwanda has around 2000 children who have been involved in the war.</s>

en: UNICEF says, even though some of the children do not directly engage in fighting, they are exposed to many dangers.
kin: UNICEF ivuga ko, nubwo bamwe mu bana batishora mu mirwano, bahura n'ingaruka nyinshi.
mt0: <pad> UNICEF says that, even though some children don't participate in the conflict, they are affected by many adverse effects.</s>

en: They may be used as porters, carrying very heavy loads, or as messengers or spies passing information and scouting out enemy territory.
kin: Bashobora gukoreshwa nk'abatwara ibintu, batwara imitwaro iremereye cyane, cyangwa nk'intumwa cyangwa abatasi batanga amakuru kandi bagashakisha agace k'umwanzi.
mt0: <pad> They can be used as carriers, bearing heavy loads, or as messengers or scouts giving information and searching the enemy's area.</s>

en: Sometimes, boys, but mainly girls, are used as sex slaves. They are exposed to violence and HIV-AIDS and other sexually transmitted diseases.
kin: Rimwe na rimwe, abahungu, ariko cyane cyane abakobwa, bakoreshwa nk'abacakara. Bahura n’ihohoterwa na Virus itera SIDA n'izindi ndwara zandurira mu mibonano mpuzabitsina.
mt0: <pad> Sometimes, men, but especially women, are used as slaves. They face HIV and other sexually transmitted diseases.</s>

en: The girls may become pregnant, making it harder for them to reintegrate into their communities.
kin: Abakobwa bashobora gusama, bikabagora gusubira mu miryango yabo.
mt0: <pad> Women can be pregnant, which makes it difficult for them to return to their families.</s>

en: UNICEF's Manuel Fontaine says demobilization takes time and money.
kin: Manuel Fontaine wa UNICEF avuga ko gusubiza mu buzima busanzwe bitwara igihe n'amafaranga.
mt0: <pad> Manuel Fontaine of UNICEF said that reintegration into normal life takes time and money.</s>

en: He says the children must first be found, and then removed from their government or rebel units.
kin: Avuga ko abana bagomba kubanza kuboneka, hanyuma bakavanwa muri guverinoma cyangwa mu mitwe y'inyeshyamba.
mt0: <pad> He says that children should be found first, then removed from the government or rebel groups.</s>

en: Then, resources are needed to help them rebuild their lives. That involves providing schools, vocational training and health care.
kin: Noneho, ibikoresho bikabona gukenewe kugira ngo bibafashe kubaka ubuzima bwabo. Ibyo bikubiyemo gutanga amashuri, amahugurwa y'imyuga no kwita ku buzima.
mt0: <pad> Now, they need the necessary tools to help them build their own lives. This includes education, skills training and health care.</s>

en: "You do not want to stigmatize them and individualize them.
kin: Ntawifuza kubatesha agaciro no kubatandukanya.
mt0: <pad> We don't want to devalue or discriminate against them.</s>

en: They are basically going back to communities where there are a lot of other children, many of whom have suffered from consequences of war, even if they were not recruited.
kin: Basanzwe ahanini basubira mu baturage aho usanga hari abandi bana benshi, benshi muri bo bakaba baratewe n'ingaruka z'intambara, kabone niyo baba batinjijwe mu gisirikare.
mt0: <pad> They usually return to the villages where you find many other children, many of whom have been affected by the effects of war, even if they have been recruited into the military.</s>

en: So, you are trying to build services in those communities that are broad services, that would be made available to all those children," Mr. Fontaine said.
kin: Rero, uragerageza kubaka serivisi muri iyo miryango ari serivisi zagutse, zizahabwa abo bana bose , Bwana Fontaine.
mt0: <pad> So, you're trying to build a service in that family that will be open to all the children, Mr. Fontaine.</s>

en: Mr. Fontaine says, as part of various peace packages in the Great Lakes region, the World Bank and other donors are providing $500 million to help demobilize children.
kin: Bwana Fontaine avuga ko, mu rwego rwo guharanira amahoro atandukanye mu karere k'ibiyaga bigari, Banki y'Isi n'abandi baterankunga batanga miliyoni 500 z'amadolari yo gufasha abana mu bikorwa.
mt0: <pad> Mr Fontaine said that, in order to fight for peace in the region of the Mediterranean Sea, the World Bank and other donors are giving 500 million US dollars to support children's projects.</s>

en: He says, unfortunately, the needed government institutions are not yet in place in some countries to move the process ahead quickly enough.
kin: Avuga ko ikibabaje ari uko inzego za Leta zikenewe zitarashyirwaho mu bihugu bimwe na bimwe kugira ngo inzira igerweho vuba bihagije.
mt0: <pad> He says that the sad part is that the necessary governmental structures haven't been set up in some countries to speed up the process.</s>

en: He says that's why UNICEF is pressing to see such structures develop, so that children can get back home and start to lead normal lives once again.
kin: Avuga ko ari yo mpamvu UNICEF irihatira kubona izo nzego zitera imbere, kugira ngo abana basubire mu rugo batangire kubaho ubuzima busanzwe.
mt0: <pad> He said that's why UNICEF is trying to see those agencies develop, so that the children can return home and start living normal lives.</s>

en: World Bank, Nike Team Up for 'The Girl Effect' Initiative
kin: Banki y'Isi, n'Itsinda Nike ku ngaruka umukobwa ahura na zo.
mt0: <pad> The World Bank and the Nike Group on the effects women face.</s>

en: The Adolescent Girls Initiative partners the World Bank, the Nike Foundation and governments of developing and developed nations to empower girls in poor countries.
kin: Ishyirahamwe ry'abakobwa b'ingimbi rifatanya na Banki y'Isi, Fondasiyo ya Nike na guverinoma z'ibihugu bikiri mu nzira y'amajyambere n'ibyateye imbere mu guha imbaraga abakobwa mu bihugu bikennye.
mt0: <pad> The UN Women works with the World Bank, Nike Foundation and governments of developing and developed countries to empower women in low-income countries.</s>

en: The two-year-old program is helping girls in Asia, Africa and the Middle East gain the education and skills they need to transition into the workforce.
kin: Gahunda imaze imyaka ibiri ifasha abakobwa bo muri Aziya, Afurika no mu burasirazuba bwo hagati kunguka ubumenyi n'ubuhanga bakeneye kugira ngo bashobore guhangana ku isoko ry'umurimo.
mt0: <pad> The two-year program has helped women in Asia, Africa and the Middle East gain the knowledge and skills they need to compete in the job market.</s>

en: "My name is Sanchita. I come from a small village called Ishwarpur in Bangladesh," American actress Anne Hathaway delivered her lines as powerfully from behind a podium at the World Bank as she does on the silver screen, telling the story of an impoverished girl.
kin: Nitwa Sanchita. Nkomoka mu mudugudu muto witwa Ishwarpur muri Bangladesh." Umukinnyi w'amafirime ukomoka muri Amerika, Anne Hathaway, yatanze umurongo ukomeye cyane inyuma ya podium kuri Banki y'Isi nk'uko abikora kuri ecran ya silver, avuga amateka y'umukobwa ukennye.
mt0: <pad> My name is Sanchita. I come from a small village in Ishwarpur in Bangladesh."</s>

en: "When a baby is born in Ishwarpur, families desperately hope it will be a boy," she continued. "It has been this way for as long as anyone can remember.
kin: Yakomeje agira ati: "Iyo umwana avukiye Ishwarpur, imiryango ntiba yizeye ko azaba umuhungu." "Byabaye gutya igihe cyose umuntu ashobora kwibuka.
mt0: <pad> He added: "When a child was born in Ishwarpur, the family didn't think he would be a boy." "This has been the case for as long as one can remember."</s>

en: It is believed that boys will contribute to the family income in a place where people are very poor.
kin: Byizerwa ko abahungu bagira uruhare mu muryango rwo kwinjiza umutungo ahantu abantu bakennye cyane.
mt0: <pad> It is believed that men have a role in the family to increase the wealth in poor areas.</s>

en: "These circumstances are familiar to those who benefit from the Adolescent Girls Initiative.
kin: Ibi bihe biramenyerewe ku bantu bungukirwa n'ibikorwa by'abakobwa b'abangavu bafata iyambere.
mt0: <pad> This is a common time for people to benefit from the activities of young girls who take the lead.</s>

en: Who benefits?A dozen such teenage girls and young women visited the World Bank from developing Asian, Middle Eastern and African countries.
kin: Ninde ubyungukiramo? Abakobwa cumi na babiri n’abagore bakiri bato basuye Banki y'isi baturutse mu bihugu bya Aziya, Uburasirazuba bwo hagati na Afurika.
mt0: <pad> Who benefits? Twelve girls and young women from Asia, Middle East and Africa visited the World Bank in New York.</s>

en: They were just a few of the girls who benefit from training and education programs that help them transition from school to employment.
kin: Bari bake mu bakobwa bungukirwa n'amahugurwa na gahunda y'uburezi bibafasha kuva mu mashuri bajya mu kazi.
mt0: <pad> Many girls don't get the training and education that helps them transition from school to work.</s>

en: Hathaway told the audience that, with the help of a development organization, Sanchita gained an education and borrowed $60 to buy a cow and start a vegetable garden.
kin: Hathaway yabwiye abari aho ko, abifashijwemo n’umuryango w’iterambere, Sanchita yize amashuri maze aguza amadorari 60 yo kugura inka no gutangiza ubusitani bw'imboga.
mt0: <pad> Hathaway told the audience that, with the help of the development organization, Sanchita studied and invested 60 dollars to buy a cow and start a potato garden.</s>

en: The teenage girl could then afford to pay her own school fees, as well as her brother's, and contribute to her family in such a way that Sanchita's parents hope she does not marry any time soon.
kin: Umukobwa w'umwangavu noneho yashoboraga kwiyishyurira amafaranga y'ishuri, kimwe na murumuna we, akanatanga umusanzu mu muryango we ku buryo ababyeyi ba Sanchita bizeye ko atazashyingirwa vuba.
mt0: <pad> The young girl could now pay her own school fees, like her sister, and provide a contribution to her family so that Sanchita's parents hoped she wouldn't get married soon.</s>

en: Hathaway spoke of her own childhood in a comfortable suburban U.S. neighborhood, and of a time when she had no idea about the kind of circumstances Sanchita faced nor how much girls need safe spaces for education.
kin: Hathaway yavuze ubwana bwe mu mugi mwiza n'abaturanyi bo muri Amerika, kandi mu gihe atigeze atekereza ku byerekeye ibihe Sanchita yahuye na byo cyangwa uko abakobwa bakeneye ahantu hizewe kugira ngo bige.
mt0: <pad> Hathaway spent his childhood in a good city with American neighbors, and while he never thought about the experiences Sanchita had or how girls needed safe places to learn, he didn't know that women need safe places to learn.</s>

en: "Places that could teach them how to take the light they have as girls and ignite the world," explained Hathaway.
kin: Hathaway yasobanuye agira Ari: "Ahantu hashobora kubigisha gufata umucyo bafite nk'abakobwa no kumurikira isi."
mt0: <pad> Hathaway explained Ari: "A place that can teach them to take their light as girls and light the world."</s>

en: "I wouldn't know how much the world needs 'The Girl Effect.'" Girl power"The Girl Effect" is what the Adolescent Girls Initiative wants to see happen for 600 million girls in developing countries.
kin: Ntabwo nari kumenya uko isi ikeneye 'Uruhare rw'umukobwa." "Imbaraga z'umukobwa" Uruhare rw'umukobwa "ni cyo Gufata iyambere bishaka kwerekana ku bakobwa miliyoni 600 mu bihugu bikiri mu nzira y'amajyambere.
mt0: <pad> I didn't know the world needed 'The Role of the Woman.' "The Power of the Woman" The Role of the Woman "is a leading initiative that seeks to show 600 million women in developing countries the power of the woman.</s>

en: Overall, an estimated one-third of young women in developing nations are not employed and not in school.World Bank President Robert Zoellick said underinvesting in girls impedes development.
kin: Muri rusange, abagera kuri kimwe cya gatatu cy’abagore bakiri bato mu bihugu bikiri mu nzira y'amajyambere ntibakoreshwa kandi ntibari no mu ishuri. Perezida wa Banki y'Isi, Robert Zoellick, yavuze ko gushora imari mu bakobwa bidindiza iterambere.
mt0: <pad> In general, about one-third of young women in developing countries are unemployed and out of school. The president of the World Bank, Robert Zoellick, said that not investing in girls hinders development.</s>

en: He added that educating girls also makes sense for poor families, noting that an extra year of secondary schooling can raise their wages by 10 to 20 percent.
kin: Yongeyeho ko kwigisha abakobwa na byo byumvikana ku miryango ikennye, anagaragaza ko umwaka w’inyongera w’amashuri yisumbuye ushobora kuzamura umushahara wabo kugeza kuri 10%.
mt0: <pad> He added that educating girls is also sensible for poor families, and showed that an extra year of high school can raise their wages by 10%.</s>

en: "If they earn greater income they also have greater access to reproductive health information and services, so then more likely to delay marriage and childbirth, have healthier babies and attain higher literacy rates," Zoellick said.
kin: Zoellick ati: "Niba binjiza amafaranga menshi kandi bafite amahirwe menshi yo kumenya amakuru na serivisi z'ubuzima bw'imyororokere, birashoboka cyane ko batinda gushaka no kubyara, bakagira abana bafite ubuzima bwiza kandi bakabona umubare munini w'abazi gusoma no kwandika".
mt0: <pad> Zoellick said: "If they earn more and have better access to information and health services, it is likely that they will be less likely to get married and have children, have healthy children and see a greater number of literate people."</s>

en: "The evidence strongly suggests that investing in adolescent girls is a key way to break inter-generational patterns of poverty."
kin: Ibimenyetso byerekana neza ko gushora imari mu bakobwa b'ingimbi ari inzira y'ingenzi yo guca ukubiri n''ubukene. "
mt0: <pad> The evidence clearly indicates that investing in young girls is an important way to overcome poverty.</s>

en: Current operations The Adolescent Girls Initiative public-private partnership, with its $20 million in funds, is already at work in seven countries, with plans to expand to Haiti and Yemen. Mayra Buvinic talks about the Adolescent Girls Initiative
kin: Mayra Buvinic avuga ku byerekeye gahunda y'abakobwa b'ingimbi ati: "Ibikorwa biriho ubu by'Ugufata iyambere kw'abakobwa b'ingimbi, mu bufatanye bwa leta n’abikorera ku giti cyabo, hamwe na miliyoni 20 z’amadorali, bumaze gukorera mu bihugu birindwi, bikaba biteganijwe ko byaguka muri Haiti na Yemeni."
mt0: <pad> Mayra Buvinic says about the program for young girls: "The current activities of the Young Girls' Empowerment, in partnership with government and private sectors, with 20 million US dollars, have worked in seven countries, and are expected to expand to Haiti and Yemeni."</s>

en: "So where we are in Liberia and Nepal, young women are completing the first rounds of training," explained Mayra Buvinic, director of Gender and Development at the World Bank.
kin: Aho rero turi muri Liberiya no muri Nepal, abakobwa bakiri bato bararangiza icyiciro cya mbere cy'amahugurwa, "ibi bikaba byavuzwe na Mayra Buvinic, umuyobozi ushinzwe uburinganire n'iterambere muri banki y'isi.
mt0: <pad> "So here in Liberia and Nepal, young girls have already completed the first stage of training," said Mayra Buvinic, director of gender and development at the World Bank.</s>

en: "In South Sudan, 100 adolescent girls' clubs will have opened in four states by the end of this month. In Jordan, female community college graduates are gaining access to vouchers.
kin: Muri Sudani yepfo, amakarabu 100 y'ingimbi azaba amaze gufungura muri leta enye mu mpera z'uku kwezi. Muri Yorodani, abategarugori barangije kaminuza bamaze kubona ibyangombwa.
mt0: <pad> In South Sudan, 100 pig carts will be loaded into four states by the end of this month. In Jordan, women who have graduated from university have received their certificates.</s>

en: In Afghanistan, Lao PDR and Rwanda, assessments are being completed, and the projects will be launched at the end of this quarter.
kin: Muri Afuganisitani, Lao PDR n'u Rwanda, isuzuma ririmo kurangira, kandi imishinga izatangira mu mpera z'iki gihembwe.
mt0: <pad> In Afghanistan, Lao PDR and Rwanda, the evaluation is nearing completion, and projects will start at the end of this cycle.</s>

en: "Thanks and praise Kebbeh Kamara tells the audience how she's benefited from the World Bank/Nike initiative
kin: "Murakoze kandi ndabashimiye" Kebbeh Kamara abwira abari aho uburyo yungukiye muri gahunda ya Banki y'Isi / Nike.
mt0: <pad> "Thank you and thank you all," Kebbeh Kamara told the audience how he benefited from the World Bank/Nike program.</s>

en: Kebbeh Kamara said she has benefited from training in Greater Monrovia, Liberia.
kin: Kebbeh Kamara yavuze ko yungukiye mu mahugurwa muri Greater Monrovia, Liberiya.
mt0: <pad> Kebbeh Kamara said he earned his education in Greater Monrovia, Liberia.</s>

en: Wearing a pink dress and sporty black headband decorated with rhinestones, she addressed the World Bank audience from the stage.
kin: Yambaye umwenda wijimye hamwe n'igitambaro cya siporo bambara ku mutwe cy'umukara k'imitako irimbishijwe amabuye, yabwiye abitabiriye banki yisi kuva ku rukiniro.
mt0: <pad> He was dressed in a stylish suit and black sports cape on a brown head of pearl-encrusted jewelry, he told the crowd from the stage that the bank was closed.</s>

en: "I learned how to start a business, how to earn money on your own, how to be self-sustainable," she said, "how to save money and what to spend money for.
kin: "Nize uburyo bwo gutangira umushinga, uburyo bwo kubona amafaranga ubwawe, uburyo bwo kwibeshaho", ati: "uburyo bwo kuzigama amafaranga n'icyo gukoresha amafaranga."
mt0: <pad> "I learned how to start a business, how to make money yourself, how to survive," he said, "how to save money and how to use money."</s>

en: " Sarah Poni Saturnino, 19, of Juba, Southern Sudan, told VOA she is enjoying her first trip to the United States and all the empowerment training and activities.
kin: Sarah Poni Saturnino, ufite imyaka 19, i Juba, muri Sudani y'Amajyepfo, yabwiye VOA ko yishimiye urugendo rwe rwa mbere muri Amerika ndetse n'amahugurwa n'ibikorwa byose byo kumwongerera ubushobozi.
mt0: <pad> Sarah Poni Saturnino, 19, from Juba, South Sudan, told VOA she enjoyed her first trip to the United States and all the training and activities that were offered to her.</s>

en: She said she hopes to take the lessons she has learned here in workshops back to the Adolescent Girls Initiative clubs in Southern Sudan.
kin: Yavuze ko yizeye kuzakura amasomo mu byo yigiye hano mu mahugurwa agasubira mu ma club y'Abangavu mu Gufata Iyambere yo muri Sudani y'Amajyepfo.
mt0: <pad> He said he hoped to take advantage of what he learned here in the training and return to the youth clubs of South Sudan's Youth Self-Defense.</s>

en: "I learned about how to express yourself. Eye contact. Speak loud," explained Saturnino. "This way can give me really a voice to speak in front of people.
kin: Saturnino yabisobanuye agira ati: "Nize uburyo bwo kwisobanura. Kureba mu amaso. Kuvuga cyane." Ubu buryo bushobora kumpa ijwi ryo kuvuga imbere y'abantu.
mt0: <pad> Saturnino explained: "I learned to express myself. Look in the eye. Speak loudly." This technique can give me a voice to speak in front of a crowd.</s>

en: And even if I go back home, I'm not longer Sarah again -- I'm somebody now." Somebody who has earned the admiration of a fellow Southern Sudanese citizen, child-soldier-turned-rapper Emmanuel Jal.
kin: Nubwo naba nsubiye mu rugo, sinzongera kuba Sarah - Ndi umuntu ubu. "Umuntu wigeze gushimwa na mugenzi we wo muri Sudani y'Amajyepfo, umwana w'umusirikare-wahindutse umuraperi Emmanuel Jal.
mt0: <pad> Even if I'm back home, I'm not Sarah anymore - I'm a person now."</s>

en: A supporter of the Adolescent Girls Initiative, Jal performed at the World Bank event.
kin: Umushyigikire wItsinda ry'Abakobwa b'Abangavu bafata Iyambere, Jal yagaragaye mu birori bya Banki y'isi.
mt0: <pad> Supporter of the Rising Women's Group, Jal appeared at a World Bank event.</s>

en: The girls joined him on stage, beaming as they danced behind him -- as did at least one World Bank official -- while the audience of staffers in business suits took to their feet and raised their hands in the air as well.
kin: Abakobwa bamusanze ku rubyiniro, bafatanya kubyina ubwo babyinaga inyuma - kimwe n’umuyobozi nibura umwe mu bayobozi ba Banki y’isi - mu gihe abari bateraniye aho bari bambaye imyenda y’akazi bakoraga ku birenge maze bakazamura amaboko mu kirere.
mt0: <pad> The women went up to him, danced with him while he was dancing behind him - as well as at least one of the Bank's top executives - while the audience of men dressed in business suits stood on their knees and raised their hands to the sky.</s>

en: Activists Press for Better Help to End Congo Rapes
kin: Abanyamakuru baharanira gufasha mu guhagarika gufata ku ngufu muri congo.
mt0: <pad> Journalists try to help stop rape in Congo</s>

en: As U.N. Special Representative for Sexual Violence In Conflict Margot Wallstrom embarks on a new trip to the Democratic Republic of Congo, two activists recently concluded lobbying efforts in the United States for more effective action on trying to end conflict-related rapes in Congo.
kin: Mu gihe uhagarariye Umuryango w’abibumbye ushinzwe ihohoterwa rishingiye ku gitsina mu makimbirane Margot Wallstrom atangiye urugendo rushya muri Repubulika Iharanira Demokarasi ya Kongo, abarwanashyaka babiri baherutse gusoza ibikorwa byo guharanira inyungu muri Leta zunze ubumwe za Amerika kugira ngo barusheho gufata ingamba zo gushaka guhagarika ihohoterwa rishingiye ku makimbirane muri Kongo.
mt0: <pad> While UN special envoy to conflict violence Margot Wallstrom begins a new mission in the Republic of the Congo, two activists have recently ended their non-profit activities in the United States to try to take action to stop conflict-related violence in the Democratic Republic of the Congo.</s>

en: One of them, Justine Masika Bihamba, told a gathering of Washington, D.C., university students and concerned citizens that the area in which she works, Beni, in North Kivu province, is still overrun by Ugandan rebels who regularly rape women.She said in these situations women are considered victims, and are not implicated in the search for peace.
kin: Umwe muri bo, Justine Masika Bihamba, yabwiye abari bateraniye i Washington, muri Leta zunze ubumwe za Amerika, abanyeshuri ba kaminuza ndetse n’abaturage bireba ko akarere akoreramo, Beni, mu ntara ya Kivu y’amajyaruguru, gakomeje kwigarurirwa n’inyeshyamba zo muri Uganda zikunze gufata abagore ku ngufu.
mt0: <pad> One of them, Justine Masika Bihamba, told the Washington Conference in Washington, U.S., students at the university and local people that her area, Beni, in the north Kivu region, is continuing to be seized by Ugandan rebels who frequently rape women.</s>

en: She said in these situations women are considered victims, and are not implicated in the search for peace.
kin: Avuga ko muri ibi bihe abagore bafatwa nkabahohotewe, kandi ntibagira uruhare mugushakisha amahoro.
mt0: <pad> He says that in these days women are treated as victims, and do not participate in peace-making.</s>

en: Striving for peace in the region
kin: Guharanira amahoro mu karere
mt0: <pad> Working for peace in the region</s>

en: Bihamba coordinates an organization called the Synergy of Women Against Sexual Violence.
kin: Bihamba ahuza umuryango witwa Synergy y'abagore wo kurwanya ihohoterwa rishingiye ku gitsina.
mt0: <pad> Bihamba is the coordinator of the women's group Synergy to fight against sexual violence.</s>

en: Counselors with the group have been attacked and threatened because of their work.
kin: Abajyanama hamwe n'itsinda baratewe kandi babangamiwe n'ibikorwa byabo.
mt0: <pad> The advisors and the team were praised and appreciated for their work.</s>

en: When Bihamba was at work one day, Congolese soldiers attacked her home, and sexually assaulted one of her daughters.
kin: Umunsi umwe ubwo Bihamba yari ku kazi, abasirikari ba congo bateye iwe, basambanya umwe mu bakobwa be.
mt0: <pad> One day while Bihamba was at work, the Congolese soldiers broke into his house and raped one of his daughters.</s>

en: One of them, Justine Masika Bihamba, told a gathering of Washington, D.C., university students and concerned citizens that the area in which she works, Beni, in North Kivu province, is still overrun by Ugandan rebels who regularly rape women.
kin: Bihamba yasobanuye ko igikenewe - ikiruta byose - ari amahoro mu burasirazuba bwa Kongo.
mt0: <pad> Bihamba explained that what is needed - above all - is peace in the east of Congo.</s>

en: She said she believes sexual crimes would go down drastically if fighting stopped.
kin: Yavuze ko yizera ko ibyaha by'ihohotera rishingiye ku gitsina bizagabanuka cyane imirwano iramutse ihagaze.
mt0: <pad> He said he believed that sex crimes would decrease significantly if the war was stopped.</s>

en: Activist Donatella Rostagno, from the European network for Central Africa, accompanied Bihamba on her trip to the United States.
kin: Umurwanashyaka Donatella Rostagno, ukomoka mu ihuriro ry’iburayi rikorera muri Afurika yo hagati, yaherekeje Bihamba mu rugendo rwe muri Amerika.
mt0: <pad> The MEP Donatella Rostagno, from the European Union's Central African Committee, accompanied Bihamba on his trip to America.</s>

en: She said she supports the work being done by the U.N. special representative for sexual violence in conflict.
kin: Yavuze ko ashyigikiye imirimo ikorwa n’uhagarariye Umuryango w’abibumbye ushinzwe ihohoterwa rishingiye ku gitsina mu makimbirane.
mt0: <pad> He said he supported the work of UN Special Envoy to Women's Rights in conflict.</s>

en: Rostagno also said feels, however, the international community is not doing enough to stop Congo's war, despite having a large U.N. peacekeeping mission there.
kin: Rostagno yavuze kandi ko abyumva, ariko ko, umuryango mpuzamahanga udakora ibishoboka byose ngo uhagarike intambara ya Congo, nubwo hariyo akazi katoroshye ku Muryango w'Abibumbye ko kubungabunga amahoro.
mt0: <pad> Rostagno also said that he understood, but that the international community did not do all it could to stop the conflict in Congo, although the UN had a difficult task of keeping peace in Congo.</s>

en: "The majority of the actions is made to look at the consequences, to work with the women who are victims, but not enough is done to look at the causes of the rapes and the conflict," said Rostagno.
kin: Rostagno ati: "Ibyinshi mu bikorwa bikorwa kugira ngo harebwe ingaruka, gukorana n'abagore bahohotewe, ariko ntibihagije kugira ngo harebwe ibitera gufata ku ngufu n'amakimbirane."
mt0: <pad> Rostagno said: "Many actions are done to see the effects, working with victims, but not enough to see the causes of abuse and conflict."</s>

en: Deteriorating situation amid global concern
kin: Ibintu byifashe nabi kandi biteye impungenge isi
mt0: <pad> The situation is bad and very worrying.</s>

en: She fears the overall situation in eastern Congo is getting worse, not better - despite the international attention - with rebels, militias, and renegade soldiers still running rampant.
kin: Afite ubwoba ko muri rusange mu burasirazuba bwa Kongo , ibintu bigenda birushaho kuba bibi - nubwo amahanga abitayeho - inyeshyamba, imitwe yitwara gisirikare, n'abasirikare bigometse bikomeje kwiyongera.
mt0: <pad> He fears that in general in the east of Congo, things are getting worse - despite international attention - rebels, militias and renegade soldiers continue to grow.</s>

en: "A lot of these rebel groups are getting reorganized, and are even getting in a coalition so the movements that we see in the region, it is worrying us," said Rostagno.
kin: Rostagno ati: "Benshi muri iyo mitwe y'inyeshyamba barimo kongera kuvugururwa, ndetse bakinjira mu ihuriro bityo imitwe tubona mu karere, iraduhangayikishije."
mt0: <pad> Rostagno said: "Many of these rebel groups are re-organising and joining the coalition so the number of rebel groups we see in the region, is very concerning."</s>

en: "I think we were more optimistic on this region six months ago than today.
kin: Ndatekereza ko twagize ibyiringiro muri kano karere amezi atandatu ashize kurusha uyu munsi.
mt0: <pad> I think we had more hope in this region six months ago than today.</s>

en: "The United Nations has identified three armed groups that gang raped dozens of people about two months ago in a week-long attack in Luvungi, another part of North Kivu province.
kin: Umuryango w'abibumbye wagaragaje imitwe itatu yitwaje intwaro yasambanyije ku gahato abantu benshi mu gihe cy'amezi abiri ashize mu gitero cyabereye i Luvungi, mu kindi gice cy'intara ya Kivu y'Amajyaruguru.
mt0: <pad> UN troops have identified three militias that raped many people in the past two months in a attack in Luvungi, another part of the North Kivu region.</s>

en: Those implicated are the Mai Mai Cheka, the Democratic Liberation Forces of Rwanda, and followers of an army deserter, Colonel Emmanuel Nsengiyumva.
kin: Ababigizemo uruhare ni Mai Mai Cheka, Ingabo ziharanira Demokarasi yo Kwibohoza mu Rwanda, hamwe n'abayoboke b'umuntu watorotse ingabo, Colonel Emmanuel Nsengiyumva.
mt0: <pad> The actors were Mai Mai Cheka, the Rwandese Resistance Army, and supporters of a fugitive soldier, Colonel Emmanuel Nsengiyumva.</s>

en: Proposals for improvementDuring their presentation, the two activists, Bihamba and Rostagno, also offered concrete proposals to make the situation better.
kin: Ibyifuzo byo kunoza. Mu gihe cyo kwerekana uko byifashe, abaharanira inyungu bombi, Bihamba na Rostagno, na bo batanze ibyifuzo bifatika kugira ngo ibintu birusheho kuba byiza.
mt0: <pad> Suggested improvements. During the presentation, both parties, Bihamba and Rostagno, also offered concrete suggestions to improve things.</s>

en: Rostagno explained that foreign non-governmental organizations get funding to tackle the issue of sexual violence, but local organizations often get ignored.
kin: Rostagno yasobanuye ko imiryango itegamiye kuri Leta y’amahanga ibona inkunga yo gukemura ikibazo cy’ihohoterwa rishingiye ku gitsina, ariko imiryango y'aho ikunze kwirengagizwa.
mt0: <pad> Rostagno explained that international NGOs receive support to tackle the issue of sexual abuse, but local NGOs are often ignored.</s>

en: She said complex applications to get outside funding favor bigger organizations.
kin: Yavuze ko gusaba bigoye cyane kubona inkunga yo hanze y'imiryango minini.
mt0: <pad> He said it was very difficult to ask for foreign aid for small families.</s>

en: "They can just do it, they send it, they receive the money.
kin: Bashobora kubikora, bakabyohereza, bakabona amafaranga.
mt0: <pad> They can make it, sell it, and make money.</s>

en: The problem is that the money in most cases is spent to pay for the fixed cost of the organization, for the salaries of expat people coming to the region and to the country, while the local non-governmental organizations, those working with the communities, with the women, with the children, in the villages, those who need need money to survive in order to do their work do not have access," said Rostagno. Bihamba said Congolese soldiers should be paid directly through bank withdrawals, rather than being paid through their superiors.
kin: Ikibazo ni uko amafaranga menshi akoreshwa mu kwishyura ikiguzi cyagenwe cy'umuryango, ku mishahara y'inzobere ziza mu karere ndetse no mu gihugu, mu gihe imiryango itegamiye kuri leta yaho, ikorana n'abaturage, hamwe n'abagore n'abana, mu midugudu, abakeneye amafaranga kugira ngo babeho kugira ngo bakore akazi kabo ntibayabone ”, ibi bikaba byavuzwe na Rostagno. Bihamba yavuze ko abasirikare ba Kongo bakwiye guhembwa binyuze mu kubikuza mu mabanki, aho guhembwa binyuze ku bayobozi babo.
mt0: <pad> The problem is that much of the money is used to pay for a family budget, for the salaries of experts from the region and the country, while local non-governmental organizations working with the people, including women and children, in the villages, don't get the money to live and work for their own lives," said Rostagno.</s>

en: Bihamba said with the current system they receive only about a third of their salary, which causes some soldiers to loot and rape.
kin: Bihamba yavuze ko hamwe n'uburyo buriho bahabwa gusa kimwe cya gatatu cy'umushahara wabo, bigatuma bamwe mu basirikare basahura no gufata ku ngufu.
mt0: <pad> Bihamba said that under the current system, they are only paid a third of their salary, which has led to some soldiers stealing and rape.</s>

en: She also called for an international tribunal for the Congo to help end general impunity, as well as more local tribunals for raped victims to seek justice.
kin: Yasabye kandi urukiko mpuzamahanga rwa Kongo kugira ngo rufashe guca burundu umuco wo kudahana muri rusange, ndetse n'inkiko nyinshi z’abafashwe ku ngufu kugira ngo barenganurwe.
mt0: <pad> He also called for an international court of the Republic of the Congo to help end the culture of injustice in general, and many prison courts for rape victims to be set up to provide justice.</s>

en: In North Kivu, where more than 5 million people are estimated to live, she said there are only three tribunals.
kin: Mu majyaruguru ya Kivu, aho bivugwa ko abantu barenga miliyoni 5 batuye, yavuze ko hari inkiko eshatu gusa.
mt0: <pad> In the north of Kivu, where it is estimated that over 5 million people live, he said there were only three courts.</s>

en: Desmond Tutu Retires From Public Life
kin: Desmond Tutu yasezeye mu buzima rusange.
mt0: <pad> Desmond Tutu resigned from public life.</s>

en: Desmond Tutu fought apartheid in South Africa, and was critical of the war in Iraq.
kin: Desmond Tutu yarwanyije ivangura muri Afurika y'Epfo, kandi yanenze intambara yo muri Iraki.
mt0: <pad> Desmond Tutu fought against apartheid in South Africa, and condemned the war in Iraq.</s>

en: "We waged a war that shouldn't have happened," he said.He also spoke out against genocide in Rwanda.
kin: Ati: "Twakoze intambara itagomba kubaho". Yavuze kandi ku kurwanya jenoside yakorewe mu Rwanda.
mt0: <pad> He said: "We have done a war that should not have happened."</s>

en: "God have mercy on us," he said.The retired Anglican archbishop announced in July that he would retire from public life on his birthday."
kin: Ati: "Imana itugirire impuhwe." Umwepiskopi mukuru wa Anglican uri mu kiruhuko cy'izabukuru yatangaje muri Nyakanga ko azasezera mu buzima rusange ku munsi w'amavuko.
mt0: <pad> He said: "God have mercy on us." The Anglican Archbishop of Canterbury, who is on a retirement, announced in August that he will step down from the public life on his birthday.</s>

en: The time has come to slow down, and sip maybe rooibos tea with my beloved wife in the afternoons" he said.
kin: Ati: "Igihe kirageze cyo gutinda, kandi tunywa icyayi cya rooibos hamwe n'umugore wanjye nkunda nyuma ya saa sita".
mt0: <pad> He said: "It's time to relax, and we're drinking rooibos tea with my dear wife after noon."</s>

en: Tutu rose through the ranks of the Anglican church in South Africa to become the first black Anglican archbishop of Capetown.
kin: Tutu yazamutse mu ntera mu itorero ry'Abangilikani muri Afurika y'Epfo aba umwepiskopi wa mbere w’abirabura wa Anglican wa Capetown.
mt0: <pad> Tutu rose to a position in the Anglican Church in South Africa and became the first black Anglican bishop of Capetown.</s>

en: He was a vocal critic of South Africa's white-ruled government and encouraged non-violence to end apartheid.
kin: Yamaganaga cyane guverinoma iyobowe n’abazungu kandi ashishikariza kurwanya ihohoterwa no kurangiza ivangura.
mt0: <pad> He was very critical of the white-led government and urged against violence and ending discrimination.</s>

en: Tutu was the recipient of many awards, and in 1984, he received a Nobel Peace Prize for advocating "a democratic and just society without racial divisions.
kin: "Tutu ni we wahawe ibihembo byinshi, maze mu 1984, ahabwa igihembo cy’amahoro cyitiriwe Nobel kubera ko yashyigikiye "sosiyete ishingiye kuri demokarasi kandi itabera idafite amacakubiri ashingiye ku moko."
mt0: <pad> Tutu has received many awards, and in 1984 he was awarded the Nobel Peace Prize for his support for "a democratic and fair society without race discrimination."</s>

en: " He used the recognition to step up the anti-apartheid campaign, calling for an economic boycott against South Africa.
kin: Yakoresheje uburyo bwo kumenyekanisha n'ingufu igikorwa cyo kurwanya ivanguramoko, asaba kwamagana ibangamirwa ry'ubukungu muri Afurika y'Epfo.
mt0: <pad> He used the medium to promote the fight against racial discrimination, calling for the end of economic sanctions in South Africa.</s>

en: After the end of apartheid, Tutu called it an incredible day when Nelson Mandela won South Africa's first all-race elections.
kin: Nyuma y'ivangura rya apartheid, Tutu yavuze ko ari umunsi udasanzwe ubwo Nelson Mandela yatsindaga amatora ya mbere yo muri Afurika y'Epfo.
mt0: <pad> After the apartheid, Tutu said it was a special day when Nelson Mandela won the first South African presidential election.</s>

en: "I would say the highest point for me was when I stood on the balcony in 1994 to introduce our new, brand new president to South Africa and the world," he said.
kin: Ati: "Navuga ko ingingo isumba izindi kuri njye ari igihe nahagararaga kuri ruhimbi mu 1994 kugira ngo menyekanishe perezida mushya, mushya muri Afurika y'Epfo no ku isi".
mt0: <pad> He said: "I would say the most important moment for me was when I stood on the stage in 1994 to announce a new president, a new South African and a new world."</s>

en: To help mend the nation, President Mandela appointed Tutu as head of the country's Truth and Reconciliation Commission.
kin: Mu rwego rwo gufasha igihugu, Perezida Mandela yashyizeho Tutu nk'umuyobozi wa komisiyo ishinzwe ukuri n'ubwiyunge mu gihugu.
mt0: <pad> To help the country, President Mandela appointed Tutu as the head of the national commission on justice and peace.</s>

en: The group issued a report that included numerous confessions of guilt under apartheid in return for amnesty.
kin: Itsinda ryasohoye raporo ikubiyemo kwatura ibyaha byinshi muri apartheid n'itangwa ry' imbabazi.
mt0: <pad> The group published a report that condemned many crimes committed during apartheid and apologized for them.</s>

en: "It makes specific proposals on how we can cultivate a culture of human rights and of structures to insure that the atrocities of the past will not reoccur," Tutu said.Tutu also campaigned to fight poverty and AIDS.
kin: Tutu yagize ati: "Itanga ibitekerezo byihariye ku buryo dushobora kwimakaza umuco w'uburenganzira bwa muntu n'inzego kugira ngo twizere ko amarorerwa yo mu bihe byashize atazongera kubaho."
mt0: <pad> Tutu said: "It provides unique insights into how we can promote a culture of human rights and institutions to ensure that the past sufferings will not be re-enacted."</s>

en: In recent years, he expressed his disappointment in post-apartheid South Africa, especially the level of violent crime.
kin: Mu myaka yashize, yagaragaje ko atishimiye muri Afurika y'Epfo nyuma ya apartheid, cyane cyane urwego rw'ibyaha by'urugomo.
mt0: <pad> In the past years, he has expressed his displeasure with South Africa after apartheid, particularly the level of violent crime.</s>

en: Despite his withdrawal from public life, Tutu says he will continue to support his peace foundation and will remain part of a group of elder statesmen who campaign for peace and human rights.
kin: N'ubwo yavuye mu buzima rusange, Tutu avuga ko azakomeza gushyigikira umusingi w’amahoro kandi ko azakomeza kuba mu itsinda ry’abasaza bakuru baharanira amahoro n’uburenganzira bwa muntu.
mt0: <pad> Although he is out of public life, Tutu says he will continue to support the peace process and will be a member of the senior citizens' group for peace and human rights.</s>

en: But Tutu says he will no longer give interviews and, as he put it, will mostly "shut up."
kin: Ariko Tutu avuga ko atazongera gutanga ibiganiro kandi nk'uko yabivuze, ahanini "azaceceka."
mt0: <pad> But Tutu says he will not be giving any more interviews and, as he said, he will mostly "keep silent."</s>

en: "I have been part of our struggle for freedom and democracy, and I am part of the celebration that we did succeed," he said. "I have been part of the post apartheid dispensation and long for us to do infinitely better."Many say his voice will be missed.
kin: Ati: "Nagize uruhare mu rugamba rwo guharanira ubwisanzure na demokarasi, kandi ndi mu birori ko twatsinze". Nagize uruhare mu ivangura rya apartheid kandi ndifuza ko dukora neza bitagira akagero. Benshi bavuga ko ijwi rye ritazabura.
mt0: <pad> He said: "I've been involved in the fight for freedom and democracy, and I'm happy that we won". I've been involved in the apartheid system and I want to work well for ever.</s>

en: Malawi's Jacaranda School for Orphans Celebrates Christmas
kin: Ishuri Jacaranda rya Malawi ry’imfubyi ririzihiza Noheri
mt0: <pad> Malawi's Jacaranda Foster School celebrates Christmas</s>

en: The management for the Jacaranda School for Orphans in Malawis commercial capital Blantyre recently hosted a party for its students as it closed for Christmas and New Years Day holidays.
kin: Ubuyobozi bw'ishuri rya Jacaranda ry'impfubyi mu murwa mukuru w'ubucuruzi wa Malawis Blantyre riherutse gukora ibirori ku banyeshuri baryo kuko ryizihije iminsi mikuru ya Noheri n'Ubunani.
mt0: <pad> The management of Jacaranda Orphanage School in Blantyre, Malawi's commercial capital recently held an event for its students as they celebrated Christmas and New Year.</s>

en: Around 500 people including students, staff members and others from surrounding areas attended the event, which was held at the schools premises in Chigumula area.
kin: Abantu bagera kuri 500 barimo abanyeshuri, abakozi ndetse n’abandi baturutse mu turere tuhakikije bitabiriye ibirori byabereye mu bigo by’amashuri mu gace ka Chigumula.
mt0: <pad> About 500 people including students, staff and others from the surrounding areas attended the event held at the school in Chigumula.</s>

en: The party included gifts, Santa Claus, and a "dancing show case" by the students.
kin: Muri ibyo birori harimo impano, Santa Claus n'imbyino by'abanyeshuri.
mt0: <pad> The celebrations included presents, Santa Claus and students' dances.</s>

en: The school management told VOA that the yearly celebration has been a school tradition for the past 13years.
kin: Ubuyobozi bw'ishuri bwatangarije VOA ko kwizihiza isabukuru buri mwaka byabaye umuco w'ishuri mumyaka 13 ishize.
mt0: <pad> The school told VOA that celebrating the anniversary every year has been a tradition for the school for 13 years.</s>

en: The school's director, Luc Deschamps, said: "[We feel] it is very important for us to celebrate Christmas because the children do not have parents.
kin: Umuyobozi w'iryo shuri, Luc Deschamps, yagize ati: "[Twumva] ari ngombwa kuri twe kwizihiza Noheri kuko abana badafite ababyeyi.
mt0: <pad> Luc Deschamps, the head of the school, said: "We feel it is necessary for us to celebrate Christmas because the children are children without parents."</s>

en: They stay with either a grandmother or a distant aunt or uncle, and they are not able to cerebrate at home or have a party or a little bit of sweets and cake for the children.
kin: Bagumana na nyirakuru, nyirasenge cyangwa nyirarume kandi ntibashobora guterana mu rugo cyangwa kugira ibirori cyangwa akantu gato karyoshye hamwe na keke ku bana.
mt0: <pad> They live with grandparents, grandmothers or grandfathers and can't get together or have a party or something sweet and cake for the children.</s>

en: So, we provide a happy day for the children to celebrate the spirit of Christmas. And it is also a way of our children to learn to give."
kin: Rero, dukora umunsi mwiza ku bana twizihiza Noheri. Kandi ni n'inzira yo gutuma abana bacu biiga gutanga. "
mt0: <pad> So, we make a good day for children to celebrate Christmas. And it's also a way to teach our children to give.</s>

en: No media source currently available
kin: Nta soko y'amakuru ubu ihari.
mt0: <pad> No information is available now.</s>

en: Deschamps, who is also an Honorary Consul of France in Malawi, said before the main event the patrons were treated to "a nice meal" from the students.
kin: Deschamps, akaba kandi ari n'Umujyanama w’icyubahiro w’Ubufaransa muri Malawi, yavuze ko mbere y’ibirori nyamukuru abo bagenzuzi bahawe "ifunguro ryiza" n’abanyeshuri.
mt0: <pad> Deschamps, who is also the French ambassador to Malawi, said that before the ceremony the inspectors were given "a good meal" by students.</s>

en: "We had a big, big lunch with good meat and rice,[the dish made from maize flour called] nsima, of course, and vegetables.
kin: Yagize ati: "Twabonye ifunguro rya saa sita rihagije kandi rifite inyama n'umuceri mwiza, [ifunguro rikozwe mu ifu y'ibigori yitwa] nsima, ndetse n'imboga.
mt0: <pad> He said: "We had a rich lunch with meat and good rice, [a dish made from barley flour called] nsima, and even potatoes."</s>

en: And it was the students themselves who cooked the meal for everybody, for over 500 people," he said.
kin: Kandi abanyeshuri ubwabo ni bo bariteguriye buri wese, ku bantu barenga 500.
mt0: <pad> And the students themselves prepared for everyone, to over 500 people.</s>

en: One of the students, Eddah Zimba, said, "The celebrations are really cool, ... I have enjoyed myself. I have eaten, and now I am here dancing.
kin: Umwe mu banyeshuri, Eddah Zimba, yagize ati: "Ibirori ni byiza rwose, ... ubwange nishimye. Nariye, none ndimo no kubyina.
mt0: <pad> One of the students, Eddah Zimba, said: "The event is very good,... I am really happy. I have eaten, and now I'm dancing."</s>

en: What has interested me most is the gift that we have received the like the puffs, the biscuits, the squash and the dance."
kin: Icyanshimishije cyane ni impano twahawe zirimo nk'ibi puffs, ibisuguti, amashu n'imbyino. "
mt0: <pad> The most interesting things were the gifts we received which included puffs, cookies, candy and dances.</s>

en: She thanked the schools management for hosting the Christmas party for students who in most cases do not have such celebrations at home.
kin: Yashimiye ubuyobozi bw'amashuri kuba bwaremeye gukora ibirori bya Noheri ku banyeshuri usanga akenshi badafite ibirori nk'ibi mu rugo.
mt0: <pad> He thanked the school management for their support in organizing Christmas events for students who often don't have such a festivity at home.</s>

en: Another student Emmanuel Chisale said good meal aside, the event has taught him the spirit of sharing.
kin: Undi munyeshuri Emmanuel Chisale yavuze ifunguro ryiza ku ruhande rwe, ibirori byamwigishije umuco wo gusangira.
mt0: <pad> Another student, Emmanuel Chisale, said the meal was good for him, the event taught him the culture of sharing.</s>

en: "This party has brought a change in my life. I have learned that we have to have a heart for sharing one another as the Father Christmas was doing," he said.
kin: Ati: "Ibi biroro byazanye impinduka mu buzima bwanjye. Namenye ko tugomba kugira umutima wo gusangira nk'uko Papa Noheri yabikoraga".
mt0: <pad> She said: "This movie changed my life. I learned that we should have a heart of sharing like Father Christmas did.</s>

en: Founded in 2002, the Jacaranda School for Orphans is the only one in Malawi which provides free primary, secondary and tertiary education to children without parents.
kin: Ishuri ry'imfubyi rya Jacaranda ryashinzwe mu 2002, rikaba ari ryo ryonyine muri Malawi ritanga uburezi bw'amashuri abanza, ayisumbuye na kaminuza ku buntu ku bana badafite ababyeyi.
mt0: <pad> Jacaranda Orphanage School was founded in 2002, and is the only school in Malawi that provides free primary, secondary and university education to children who have no parents.</s>

en: A Malawian woman, Marie Da Silva, started the school after she returned from the United States where she spent nineteen years working as a nanny.
kin: Umugore wo muri Malawi, Marie Da Silva, yatangije ishuri nyuma yo kuva muri Amerika aho yari amaze imyaka cumi n'icyenda akora akazi ko kurera.
mt0: <pad> Marie Da Silva, a Malawian woman, began her education after returning from America where she had spent 19 years working as a babysitter.</s>

en: "In 2022, it's really undeniable that media polarization and information chaos are really fueling social divisions in ways that are pretty new," said Clayton Weimers, deputy director of RSF for the United States, told VOA.
kin: Umuyobozi wungirije wa RSF muri Leta Zunze ubumwe za Amerika, Clayton Weimers, yabwiye ibiro ntaramakuru by'Abanyamerika ati: "Mu 2022, ntawahakana ko kuba itangazamakuru rikabije ndetse n'akajagari mu makuru bitera amacakubiri mu mibereho mu buryo bushya."
mt0: <pad> Clayton Weimers, the Deputy Director of RSF in the United States, said: "In 2022, no one can deny that excessive media and information chaos are creating new barriers to life."</s>

en: He said the prevalence of partisan news around the world has come at the expense of authentic journalism.
kin: Yavuze ko ubwamamare bw'amakuru y'amashyaka ku isi bwazanywe no gutangaza amakuru nyayo.
mt0: <pad> He said that the popularity of political news in the world has been caused by the release of true information.</s>

en: The group's annual report ranks 180 countries based on the environment for independent journalism.
kin: Raporo ngarukamwaka y'itsinda rishyira ku rutonde ibihugu 180 bishingiye ku itangazamakuru ryigenga.
mt0: <pad> The group's annual report ranks 180 countries based on independent media.</s>

en: This year, however, RSF said it used a new method that blends each country's political, legal, economic, sociocultural and security conditions.
kin: Uyu mwaka ariko, RSF yavuze ko yakoresheje uburyo bushya buhuza buri gihugu mu buryo bwa politiki, amategeko, ubukungu, umuco ndetse n’umutekano.
mt0: <pad> This year, however, RSF said it used a new approach that links each country in politics, law, economics, culture and security.</s>

en: Now, the index classifies a record 28 countries as "having very bad media freedom."
kin: Noneho, urutonde rwerekana ibihugu 28 "bifite umudendezo mubi w'itangazamakuru."
mt0: <pad> Now, the list shows 28 countries "with poor press freedom."</s>

en: That group includes China, which is exporting censorship beyond its borders while also amplifying the Kremlin's propaganda on Russia's devastating war against Ukraine.
kin: Iri tsinda ririmo Ubushinwa, bwohereza ibicuruzwa hanze y’umupaka ndetse bikanashimangira poropagande ya Kremle ku ntambara ibabaje y’Uburusiya na Ukraine.
mt0: <pad> The group includes China, which export goods overseas and strengthens the Kremlin propaganda on the terrible war of Russia and Ukraine.</s>

en: Russia, China among worst
kin: Uburusiya, Ubushinwa mu bibi cyane
mt0: <pad> Russia, China are very bad.</s>

en: Since its invasion of Ukraine on February 24, Russia has sought total control over news coverage, passing a new law that carries 15-year prison terms for reporting "false news" on the military, and even forbids calling the conflict a "war."
kin: Kuva igitero cyagabwa muri Ukraine ku ya 24 Gashyantare, Uburusiya bwashatse kugenzura amakuru yose, butora itegeko rishya rigena igifungo cy’imyaka 15 kubera itangazwa "ry'amakuru y'ibinyoma" ku gisirikare, ndetse rikabuza kuvuga ko amakimbirane ari "intambara."
mt0: <pad> Since the attack on Ukraine on February 24, Russia has tried to control all information, adopting a new law that sets 15 years in prison for "false information" about the military, and prohibiting calling the conflict a "war."</s>

en: That has forced most remaining independent news outlets, including the renowned Novaya Gazeta newspaper, Ekho Moskvy radio and Dozhd TV, to shut down or move outside Russia to continue operating.
kin: Ibyo bikaba byaratumye ibitangazamakuru byinshi byigenga bisigaye, birimo ikinyamakuru kizwi cyane cya Novaya Gazeta, radiyo Ekho Moskvy na TV ya Dozhd, bihagarika cyangwa byimukira mu Burusiya kugira ngo bikomeze gukora.
mt0: <pad> That has led to many of the remaining independent media, including the popular Novaya Gazeta, radio Ekho Moskvy and TV Dozhd, closing or relocating to Russia to continue their work.</s>

en: With independent voices absent, experts say, the Russian government has been able to flood state-run airwaves with propaganda that downplays the war and spreads false or misleading justifications for the Kremlin's invasion.
kin: Impuguke zivuga ko mu gihe amajwi yigenga adahari, guverinoma y’Uburusiya yashoboye gukwiza amakuru ya leta hamwe na poropagande yerekana intambara kandi ikwirakwiza impamvu z’ibinyoma cyangwa zibeshya ku gitero cya Kremle.
mt0: <pad> Experts say that without independent voices, the Russian government could manipulate state media and propaganda to present war and propagate false or misleading reasons for the Kremlin attack.</s>

en: Russia's media repression stands at 155 out of 180 countries included in RSF's index, where one is the most free and 180 the least.
kin: Ihohoterwa ry’itangazamakuru ry’Uburusiya rihagaze ku bihugu 155 mu bihugu 180 byashyizwe ku rutonde rwa RSF, aho kimwe ari cyo kiba gifite ubwisanzure kandi 180 bikaba bifite ubwisanzure buke.
mt0: <pad> Russia's media abuse ranks 155 of the 180 countries on the RSF list, where one is free and 180 are poorly free.</s>

en: "It's safe to say at this point that the free press is a thing of the past in Russia," Clayton said.
kin: Clayton ati: "Ni byiza kuvuga kuri ubu ko itangazamakuru ryigenga ari ikintu cyahise mu Burusiya."
mt0: <pad> Clayton said: "It's good to say now that independent media is a thing of the past in Russia.</s>

en: Throughout Russian President Vladimir Putin's 22 years in power, Moscow has been targeting journalists and the independent press, he said.
kin: Yavuze ko mu myaka 22 Perezida w’Uburusiya Vladimir Putin amaze ku butegetsi, Moscou yibasiye abanyamakuru n’ibitangazamakuru byigenga.
mt0: <pad> He said that in the 22 years of Russian President Vladimir Putin's rule, Moscou has attacked journalists and independent media.</s>

en: "But since the invasion of Ukraine, it seems that Putin has really finished off the independent media once and for all in Russia," Clayton said. "At this point, it is impossible to accurately report on the war in Ukraine."
kin: Clayton ati: "Ariko kuva Ukraine yaterwa, birasa nkaho Putin yarangije itangazamakuru ryigenga rimwe na rimwe mu Burusiya." Kugeza ubu, ntibishoboka gutanga raporo neza ku ntambara ibera muri Ukraine.
mt0: <pad> Clayton said: "But since Ukraine was invaded, it seems like Putin has ended some of the independent media in Russia." For now, it is difficult to provide reliable information on the conflict in Ukraine.</s>

en: China ranked 175th in the new report. And now that it is firmly under Beijing's influence, Hong Kong also registered a dramatic decline, ranking 148th out of 180 following a lengthy series of raids and arrests that shuttered pro-democracy news sites.
kin: Ubushinwa bwashyizwe ku mwanya wa 175 muri raporo nshya. Noneho, kubera ko iyobowe na Beijing, Hong Kong na yo yagabanutse ku buryo bugaragara, iza ku mwanya wa 148 kuri 180 nyuma y’igitero kinini n’ifatwa byafunze imbuga za interineti zishyigikira demokarasi.
mt0: <pad> China was placed 175th in the new report. Now, because it is led by Beijing, Hong Kong has also fallen significantly, 148th from 180 after a large attack and arrests that closed pro-democracy websites.</s>

en: RSF's country file on China says it is the world's biggest jailer of journalists, with 120 in detention. The regime uses coercion, harassment, intimidation and surveillance to keep independent and foreign journalists from reporting on issues deemed "sensitive."
kin: Idosiye ya RSF mu gihugu cy’Ubushinwa ivuga ko ari ho hari ifungwa ry’abanyamakuru benshi ku isi, 120 barafashwe. Ubutegetsi bukoresha agahato, gutotezwa, iterabwoba no kugenzura kugira ngo abanyamakuru bigenga ndetse n’abanyamahanga badatanga amakuru ku bibazo bifatwa nk’ibikomeye.
mt0: <pad> The RSF's China file says it is the country with the most journalists detained in the world, 120. The government uses intimidation, harassment, terror and control to prevent independent and foreign journalists from reporting on important issues.</s>

en: "President Xi Jinping, in power since 2013, has restored a media culture worthy of the Maoist era, in which freely accessing information has become a crime and to provide information an even greater crime," RSF's country file states.
kin: Perezida Xi Jinping, wagiye ku butegetsi kuva mu 2013, yagaruye umuco w'itangazamakuru ukwiye, mu gihe cya Maoist ho, aho kubona amakuru ku bwisanzure byabaye icyaha no gutanga amakuru bikaba icyaha gikomeye kurushaho.
mt0: <pad> President Xi Jinping, who has been in power since 2013, has restored a proper press culture, which under Maoist rule was a crime to get information freely and to report it even worse.</s>

en: Rising authoritarianism
kin: Kwiyongera k'ubutegetsi bw'igitugu
mt0: <pad> The increase in power of the state</s>

en: North Korea remains the worst country in the rankings at 180th. Elsewhere in the Asia-Pacific region, political turmoil, conflict and rising authoritarianism have wiped out years of progress.
kin: Koreya ya ruguru ikomeje kuba igihugu kibi ku rutonde kikaba icya 180. Ahandi hose mu karere ka Aziya-Pasifika, imvururu za politiki, amakimbirane hamwe n’ubutegetsi bw'igitugu byiyongereye byahanaguyeho iterambere.
mt0: <pad> North Korea remains the most corrupt country on the list, being the 180th. In other parts of Asia-Pacific, political unrest, conflicts and increased authoritarianism have hampered development.</s>

en: The 2021 coup in Myanmar marked a 10-year setback for media rights, with journalists detained, media licenses revoked, and many news outlets returning to exile.
kin: Ihirikwa ry’ubutegetsi bwo mu 2021 muri Miyanimari ryagaragaje ko hasubijwe imyaka 10 uburenganzira bw’itangazamakuru, abanyamakuru barafungwa, impushya z’itangazamakuru zivanwaho, ndetse n’ibitangazamakuru byinshi bisubira mu buhungiro.
mt0: <pad> The Myanmar coup of 2021 showed that the press freedom was restored for 10 years, journalists were arrested, media permits were revoked, and many media outlets were forced to return to exile.</s>

en: Under the military junta, Myanmar, ranking 176th, is one of the world's biggest jailers of journalists.
kin: Ku butegetsi bwa gisirikare, Miyanimari iri ku mwanya wa 176, ni hamwe mu hafunze abanyamakuru bakomeye ku isi.
mt0: <pad> Myanmar ranks 176th in the world's most politically conservative countries, and is one of the most notorious jails for journalists in the world.</s>

en: In Afghanistan, the Taliban insurgents pledged to uphold press freedom when they took power in August 2021.
kin: Muri Afuganisitani, inyeshyamba z’abatalibani ziyemeje guharanira ubwisanzure bw’itangazamakuru igihe zabafatiye ku butegetsi muri Kanama 2021.
mt0: <pad> In Afghanistan, the Taliban militants have promised to fight for press freedom when they take over power in August 2021.</s>

en: Instead, RSF said the "Taliban's seizure of power has further worsened conditions for reporters and news organizations, who are the targets of all forms of intimidation and violence." Afghanistan ranked 154th.
kin: Nyamara, RSF yavuze ko "kwigarurira ubutegetsi bw’abatalibani byarushijeho kuba bibi ku banyamakuru n’imiryango itangaza amakuru, bakaba ari bo bakorerwa iterabwoba n’urugomo." Afuganisitani iri ku mwanya wa 154.
mt0: <pad> But the RSF said that "the Taliban's takeover of Afghanistan has made it even worse for journalists and media organizations, who are now the victims of terror and crime." Afghanistan is ranked 154th in the Human Rights Index.</s>

en: Across Africa, laws criminalizing online journalism have dealt a new blow to the right to information, RSF said, while the spread of rumors, propaganda, and disinformation has contributed to undermine access to quality information.
kin: RSF yavuze ko hirya no hino muri Afurika, amategeko ahana itangazamakuru ku rubuga rwa interineti yagize ingaruka nshya ku burenganzira bwo kumenya amakuru, mu gihe ikwirakwizwa ry’ibihuha, poropagande, ndetse n’amakuru yanduye byagize uruhare mu guhungabanya amakuru meza.
mt0: <pad> RSF said that across Africa, the use of internet-based media has had a new impact on the right to know, while the dissemination of rumors, propaganda and defamation has played a role in hindering good news.</s>

en: In Ethiopia, the war in the Tigray region, with its communication blackouts and restricted access, were the main factors that placed the country 114 on the index.
kin: Muri Etiyopiya, intambara yo mu karere ka Tigray, hamwe n’itumanaho no kubuza kwinjirira amakuru, ni byo bintu nyamukuru byashyize igihugu ku rutonde rwa 114.
mt0: <pad> In Ethiopia, the conflict in Tigray region, along with communication and information censorship, were the main reasons for placing the country at the 114th place.</s>

en: Neighboring Eritrea and Djibouti are far worse, ranking near the bottom at 179 and 164, respectively.
kin: Abaturanyi ba Eritereya na Djibouti ho ni bibi cyane, biza hafi ya 179 na 164.
mt0: <pad> The neighbourhoods of Ethiopia and Djibouti are very bad, with almost 179 and 164.</s>

en: African media continue to struggle economically, RSF said it its accompanying analysis.
kin: Ibitangazamakuru byo muri Afurika bikomeje guhangana mu by’ubukungu, RSF yavuze ko isesengura rihari riherekeje.
mt0: <pad> The African media continue to compete in the economic field, RSF said.</s>

en: "Despite a wave of liberalization in the 1990s, there are still, too often, cases of arbitrary censorship, especially on the internet, with occasional network shutdowns in some countries, arrests of journalists and violent attacks," the group said.
kin: Iri tsinda ryagize riti: "Nubwo mu myaka ya za 90 habaye umudendezo wo kwishyira ukizana, haracyari, kenshi na kenshi, ibibazo byo kugenzura uko bishakiye, cyane cyane kuri interineti, rimwe na rimwe bifunga imiyoboro mu bihugu bimwe na bimwe, ifatwa ry'abanyamakuru ndetse n'ibitero by'urugomo."
mt0: <pad> The group said: "Although there was some freedom in the 1990s, there are still problems with excessive control, especially on the internet, sometimes blocking channels in some countries, arrests of journalists and threats of violence."</s>

en: Clayton said the rising authoritarianism feeds on itself.
kin: Clayton yavuze ko igitugu kigenda cyiyongera.
mt0: <pad> Clayton said that the violence was getting worse.</s>

en: "When we allow a culture of impunity to exist where authoritarians are allowed to go after journalists, harass them, arrest them, beat them in the streets and kill them, it has a knock-on effect," he said.
kin: Ati: "Iyo twemeye ko umuco wo kudahana ubaho aho abategetsi b'igitugu bemerewe gukurikirana abanyamakuru, kubatoteza, kubafata, kubakubita mu mihanda no kubica, bigira ingaruka mbi".
mt0: <pad> He said: "If we accept that a culture of injustice exists where dictatorial authorities are allowed to follow journalists, harass them, arrest them, beat them on the streets and kill them, it has bad consequences."</s>

en: "It emboldens that same authoritarian to do it again next time, and it emboldens other authoritarians who are watching to do the same."
kin: Irashimangira ubwo butegetsi bumwe bwo kuzongera kubikora ubutaha, kandi bugashimangira abandi bayobozi bareba ko babikora.
mt0: <pad> It underlines the same authority to do it again in the future, and it underlines other authorities to see that they do it.</s>

en: US not perfect
kin: Amerika ntabwo Ari intunganye
mt0: <pad> America is not perfect.</s>

en: After a period of seeing its media attacked as "fake news" by former President Donald Trump, the United States retained a relatively high ranking of 42 in RSF's index.
kin: Nyuma y'igihe kinini cyo kubona itangazamakuru ryacyo ryibasiwe "n'amakuru y'ibinyoma" n'uwahoze ari perezida Donald Trump, Amerika yagumanye umwanya wa 42 ukurikije urutonde rwa RSF.
mt0: <pad> After a long period of seeing its media affected by "fake news" by the former president Donald Trump, the United States remained in 42th place on the RSF list.</s>

en: That is largely thanks to the return of regular White House and federal agency press briefings.
kin: Ibyo ahanini tubikesha kugaruka kwa White House bisanzwe hamwe n'abanyamakuru ba federasiyo.
mt0: <pad> This is mainly due to the return of White House regulars and federal journalists.</s>

en: But RSF said problems persist, including "the disappearance of local newspapers, the systematic polarization of the media, and the erosion of journalism by digital platforms amid a climate of animosity and aggression toward journalists, among others."
kin: Ariko RSF yavuze ko ibibazo bikomeje, harimo "ibura ry'ibinyamakuru byaho, itumanaho rya buri gihe ry'itangazamakuru, ndetse no gutsemba abanyamakuru ku mbuga za interineti mu gihe hari inzangano n'ibitero byibasiye abanyamakuru, n'ibindi."
mt0: <pad> But RSF said problems remained, including "lack of local media, constant press censorship, and the internet censorship of journalists during political violence and cyber-attacks on journalists, and others."</s>

en: Barriers exist, for instance, when it comes to covering state governments and protests.
kin: Inzitizi zirahari, nk'urugero, mu gihe cyo gusigasira inzego za leta n’imyigaragambyo.
mt0: <pad> There are obstacles, for example, during the strengthening of state institutions and protests.</s>

en: "We typically find that this is either due to just a blatant disregard for the laws governing open records or meetings, or they're simply misinterpreting them.
kin: Umuyobozi mukuru w'ikigo cy'igihugu gishinzwe itangazamakuru, Beth Francesco ati: "Ubusanzwe dusanga ibyo biterwa no kwirengagiza byimazeyo amategeko agenga inyandiko zifunguye cyangwa inama, cyangwa se bakabisobanura nabi.
mt0: <pad> The National Media Council's Beth Francesco said: "We often find that this is due to either a completely ignoring of the rules on open documents or meetings, or their misinterpretation."</s>

en: An individual is misinterpreting whether a journalist can be present at a particular event," said Beth Francesco, senior director of the National Press Club Journalism Institute.
kin: Umuntu ku giti cye arimo gusobanura nabi niba umunyamakuru ashobora kwitabira ibirori runaka."
mt0: <pad> Individuals are misunderstanding whether a journalist can attend certain events.</s>

en: A few bright spots
kin: Ahantu hakeye
mt0: <pad> a small place</s>

en: Despite an overall trend of decline, Clayton said there are positives.
kin: Nubwo muri rusange bigenda bigabanuka, Clayton yavuze ko hari ibyiza.
mt0: <pad> While they are generally down, Clayton said there are some positives.</s>

en: Some governments provide funding for news media without interfering in their operations, to ensure independence from political influence.
kin: Guverinoma zimwe na zimwe zitanga inkunga mu bitangazamakuru zitivanze mu bikorwa byabyo, mu kugaragaza ubwigenge ko nta ruhare rwa politiki rurimo.
mt0: <pad> Some governments sometimes fund independent media, to show their independence that they are not politically influenced.</s>

en: "If you look at the top of our list, some of the things that stand out are these are countries that have robust public funding for media," he said, noting that "it's always important to separate state funding for media and state-controlled media."
kin: Ati: "Iyo urebye hejuru y'urutonde rwacu, bimwe mu bigaragara ni ibi bihugu bifite inkunga ya Leta mu itangazamakuru", akomeza agira ati: "Buri gihe ni ngombwa gutandukanya inkunga ya Leta mu bitangazamakuru no kugenzurwa na leta."
mt0: <pad> He said: "When you look at our list, some of the very clearest are these countries that have state media funding", he continued: "It is always important to distinguish state media funding from state control."</s>

en: Three Scandinavian countries — Norway, Denmark and Sweden — respectively come at the top of RSF's index. Estonia, a former Soviet Union republic, ranked 4th.
kin: Ibihugu bitatu bya Scandinaviya - Noruveje, Danemarke na Suwede - biza ku isonga ku rutonde rwa RSF. Esitoniya yahoze ari repubulika y’Abasoviyeti, iri ku mwanya wa 4.
mt0: <pad> Three Scandinavian countries - Norway, Denmark and Sweden - are at the top of the RSF list. Estonia, a former Soviet republic, is on the fourth place.</s>

en: RSF said the free exercise of journalism plays a major role in emerging democracies such as East Timor, ranked 17, Bhutan, ranked 33, and Mongolia, ranked 90.
kin: RSF yavuze ko itangazamakuru rikorera mu bwisanzure rigira uruhare runini muri demokarasi igaragara nka Timoru y’iburasirazuba, iri ku mwanya wa 17, Bhutani, 33, na Mongoliya iri ku mwanya wa 90.
mt0: <pad> RSF said that a free press plays a key role in visible democratic systems like East Timor, ranked 17, Bhutan, 33, and Mongoliya, ranked 90.</s>

en: East Timor was one country whose ranking skyrocketed, rising 54 places. But RSF cautioned that because of its change in methodology this year, "care should be taken when comparing the 2022 rankings and scores with those from 2021."
kin: Iburasirazuba bwa Timoru ni igihugu kimwe cyashyizwe hejuru cyane, kizamuka ahantu 54. Ariko RSF yibukije ko kubera ihinduka ry’imikorere muri uyu mwaka, "hagomba kwitonderwa iyo ugereranije amanota 2022 n'amanota yo mu 2021."
mt0: <pad> Eastern Timor is one of the countries that rose the most, up 54 places. But RSF warned that due to the change in operations this year, "there should be caution when comparing 2022 ratings with 2021 ratings."</s>
