en: UN’s Guterres Meets with Nigerian Leaders After Visiting Volatile Borno State
kin: Loni ya Guterres ihura n'abayobozi ba Nigeriya Nyuma yo gusura Leta ya Borno
mt0: <pad> The UN Secretary General met with Nigerian officials yesterday after visiting the state of Borno.</s>

en: U.N. Secretary General Antonio Guterres met with Nigerian leaders Wednesday at the end of a two-day visit to Nigeria and three-nation trip to Africa.
kin: Ku wa gatatu, umunyamabanga mukuru wa Leta zunze ubumwe za Amerika, Antonio Guterres yabonanye n’abayobozi ba Nijeriya nyuma y’uruzinduko rw’iminsi ibiri muri Nijeriya n’urugendo rw’ibihugu bitatu muri Afurika. Ku wa kabiri, yasuye abimuwe mu gihugu (IDP) mu majyaruguru y'uburasirazuba bwa Nijeriya maze abasaba ko basubizwa mu ngo zabo amahoro. Abategetsi ba Nijeriya barateganya gufunga inkambi zose z’abimuwe mu myaka mike iri imbere nubwo hari impungenge z'umutekano. Ku wa gatatu, Antonio Guterres yageze mu nzu y’umuryango w’abibumbye i Abuja ahura n’umuhuzabikorwa w’umuryango w’abibumbye mbere yo kugirana ibiganiro n’abahagarariye abagore bo muri Nijeriya.
mt0: <pad> The United States Secretary of State, Antonio Guterres, met with Nigerian officials on Wednesday after a two-day visit to Nigeria and a tour of three African countries. On Tuesday, he visited the displaced people in northeast Nigeria and urged them to return home peacefully. The Nigerian authorities plan to close all IDP camps in the next few years despite security concerns.</s>

en: The delegates, led by Nigeria's minister for womens affairs, Pauline Kedem Tallen, discussed gender equality and the inclusion of women in politics with the U.N. secretary-general.
kin: Izi ntumwa ziyobowe na minisitiri w’ibikorwa by’umugore muri Nijeriya, Pauline Kedem Tallen, baganiriye ku buringanire bw’umugore no kwinjiza abagore muri politiki n’umunyamabanga mukuru wa Amerika.
mt0: <pad> The delegation, led by the minister of women's affairs in Nigeria, Pauline Kedem Tallen, discussed gender equality and the empowerment of women in politics with U.S. Secretary of State John Kerry.</s>

en: "His coming to Nigeria today has given us hope, because we know that he will lend his voice to all the issues affecting women, gender-based violence, early marriage, lack of implementation of some of our laws," said Tallen.
kin: Tallen yagize ati: "Uyu munsi kuza muri Nijeriya byaduhaye ibyiringiro, kuko tuzi ko azatanga ijwi rye ku bibazo byose bireba abagore, ihohoterwa rishingiye ku gitsina, gushyingirwa hakiri kare, kudashyira mu bikorwa amategeko yacu."
mt0: <pad> Tallen said: "Today's visit to Nigeria gives us hope, because we know she will speak up on all issues affecting women, sexual abuse, childbirth, and the inadequate application of our laws."</s>

en: Guterres afterwards met with Nigeria's religious leaders and later attended a wreath-laying ceremony at the U.N. house to remember the 23 people killed during the 2011 bombing of the building.
kin: Nyuma Guterres yahuye n’abayobozi b’amadini ya Nijeriya nyuma aza kwitabira umuhango wo gushyira indabyo mu nzu y’umuryango w’abibumbye kugira ngo bibuke abantu 23 bishwe n'igisasu cyaturikiye mu nyubako ya 2011.
mt0: <pad> Afterwards Guterres met with religious leaders in Nigeria and attended a ceremony to place a wreath at the UN headquarters to commemorate the 23 people killed by the bomb that ripped through the building of the UN headquarters.</s>

en: He began his three-nation Africa visit Sunday in Senegal as part of his Ramadan solidarity tour, and later went to Niger.
kin: Yatangiye uruzinduko rwe muri Afurika y'ibihugu bitatu ku cyumweru muri Senegali mu rwego rwo kuzenguruka ubumwe bwa Ramadhan, nyuma ajya muri Niger.
mt0: <pad> He started his three-country African tour on Sunday in Senegal to visit the unity of Ramadan, then went to Niger.</s>

en: On Tuesday, he visited northeastern Borno state and met with the state governor as well as IDPs and families impacted by the Boko Haram conflict.
kin: Ku wa kabiri, yasuye intara y’amajyaruguru ya Leta ya Borno maze abonana na guverineri w’intara hamwe n’abimuwe n’imiryango yibasiwe n’intambara ya Boko Haram.
mt0: <pad> On Tuesday, he visited the north-eastern state of Borno and met with the governor of the state and refugees and families affected by the Boko Haram war.</s>

en: Guterres also visited repentant Boko Haram fighters and praised authorities' reintegration program for more than 1,000 former fighters.
kin: Guterres kandi yasuye abarwanyi ba Boko Haram bihannye anashimira gahunda y’abategetsi bahoze mu barwanyi barenga 1.000.
mt0: <pad> Guterres also visited the hostages of Boko Haram and thanked the governments for their efforts to bring down the more than 1,000 militants.</s>

en: He also commended authorities efforts to resettle displaced people back to their communities and called for more support to rebuild the region.
kin: Yashimye kandi ubuyobozi bwashyize ingufu mu gucyura abimuwe mu byabo kandi asaba ko hashyigikirwa kubaka izindi nyubako.
mt0: <pad> He also thanked the authorities for their efforts to relocate the displaced and urged that more housing be built.</s>

en: "The Borno that I found today is the Borno of hope, the Borno with future and I was very impressed to see the policy that is being deployed here, recognizing that you don't fight terrorism just by military means, you fight terrorism addressing the root causes of terrorism," he said.
kin: Borno nasanze aha uyu munsi ni Borno y'ibyiringiro, Borno y'ejo hazaza kandi natangajwe cyane no kubona politiki iri gukoreshwa hano, nkamenya ko utarwanya iterabwoba ukoresheje inzira za gisirikare gusa, urwanya iterabwoba rivuga n'ntandaro y'iterabwoba.
mt0: <pad> Borno I found today is Borno of hope, Borno of the future and I was very surprised to see the politics used here, to know that you don't fight terrorism by using military means only, you fight terrorism by speaking out about the source of terrorism.</s>

en: "The people that I met today in the IDP camps want to go back home in safety and dignity.
kin: Abantu nahuye na bo uyu munsi mu nkambi z'abimuwe barashaka gusubira mu rugo mu mutekano no mu cyubahiro.
mt0: <pad> The people I met today in the refugee camps want to return home safely and with dignity.</s>

en: The way to address terrorism effectively is to provide not only hope but a future of reality."
kin: Inzira yo guhangana n’iterabwoba ni ugutanga ibyiringiro ndetse ahubwo ni ejo hazaza h'ukuri.
mt0: <pad> The way to fight terrorism is to give hope and not just a brighter future.</s>

en: Nigerian authorities have been closing IDP camps since late last year and want to close all camps by 2026. More than 2 million people have been displaced from their homes since the start of the Boko Haram insurgency in 2009.
kin: Abategetsi ba Nijeriya bafunze ingando kuva mu mpera z'umwaka ushize kandi barashaka gufunga inkambi zose mu 2026. Abantu barenga miliyoni 2 bavanywe mu byabo kuva aho inyeshyamba za Boko Haram zitangiriye mu 2009.
mt0: <pad> Nigerian authorities have closed camps since the end of last year and plan to close all in 2026. Over 2 million people have been displaced since Boko Haram began in 2009.</s>

en: But aid groups have been warning some communities may still be attacked.
kin: Ariko amatsinda atabara yagiye aburira abaturage bamwe bashobora kugabwaho igitero.
mt0: <pad> But rescue teams have warned some residents that they may be at risk of an attack.</s>

en: "There are multiple solutions when it comes to resettlement. We need to get people stabilized," said Adenike Oladosu, a climate justice activist, met with the U.N. secretary-general.
kin: Adenike Oladosu, uharanira ubutabera mu by'ikirere, yabonanye n'umunyamabanga mukuru wa Leta zunze ubumwe za Amerika ati: "Hariho ibisubizo byinshi mu bijyanye no gutuza. Tugomba gutuma abantu batekana."
mt0: <pad> Adenike Oladosu, a campaigner for climate justice, said in a meeting with the United States Secretary of State: "There are many solutions to silence. We need to make people laugh.</s>

en: "Climate change is leading to the rise of armed conflicts affecting people in the region and around and the need for us to see that we have more climate action and not always military action."
kin: Imihindagurikire y’ibihe ituma amakimbirane yitwaje intwaro yiyongera ku baturage bo mu karere ndetse no hirya no hino kandi dukeneye ko tubona ko dufite ibikorwa byinshi by’ikirere kandi ko atari ko buri gihe haba ibikorwa bya gisirikare.
mt0: <pad> The climate change increases the risk of armed conflict for the people of the region and elsewhere and we need to see that we have many natural activities and that it is not always military action.</s>

en: The U.N. secretary-general ended his visit at the Abuja presidential village, where he met with President Muhammadu Buhari and his top Cabinet members.
kin: Umunyamabanga mukuru wa Leta zunze ubumwe za Amerika yakoze uruzinduko rwe mu mudugudu wa perezida wa Abuja, aho yabonanye na Perezida Muhammadu Buhari n'abagize Guverinoma bakuru.
mt0: <pad> The United States Secretary of State made a visit to the capital city of Abuja, where he met with President Muhammadu Buhari and senior government members.</s>

en: Al-Shabab Raids African Union Military Base
kin: Al-Shabab yagabye igitero ku kigo cya gisirikare cy’ubumwe bwa Afurika
mt0: <pad> Al-Shabab has claimed responsibility for the attack on the UN military base in Mogadishu.</s>

en: Al-Shabab fighters stormed an African Union military base in the village of El-Baraf in Somalias Middle Shabelle region early Tuesday, local officials and security sources say.
kin: Abayobozi b'inzego z'ibanze ndetse n'abashinzwe umutekano bavuga ko abarwanyi ba Al-Shabab bateye mu birindiro by'ingabo z’umuryango w’ubumwe bw’Afurika mu mudugudu wa El-Baraf mu karere ka Somaliya Hagati mu karere ka Shabelle.
mt0: <pad> Local and security officials say Al-Shabab militants have attacked the UN peacekeepers' base in El-Baraf village in the Somalian region of Shabelle Middle.</s>

en: Officials told VOA Somali that the militants briefly seized the base before withdrawing from it. State media said Burundian solders at the base repulsed the attack.
kin: Abayobozi babwiye VOA ikorera muri Somaliya ko abarwanashyaka bafashe ibirindiro mbere gato yo kubivamo. Ibitangazamakuru bya Leta byavuze ko abarwanyi bo mu Burundi bari mu kigo bashubije inyuma icyo gitero.
mt0: <pad> Authorities told VOA in Somalia that the rebels took over the bases before leaving. State media said Burundian guerrillas were behind the attack.</s>

en: "The Federal Government of Somalia condemns in the strongest possible terms the heinous attack targeting the African Union Transition Mission in Somalia forward operating base in Elbaraf, Middle Shabelle," the Somali Ministry of Foreign Affairs posted on its official Facebook page.
kin: Minisiteri y’ububanyi n’amahanga ya Somaliya yanditse ku rubuga rwayo rwa Facebook, igira iti: "Guverinoma y’igihugu cya Somaliya iramagana mu magambo akomeye bishoboka ko igitero kibi cyagabwe ku butumwa bw’inzibacyuho bw’umuryango w’ubumwe bw’Afurika Yunze ubumwe muri Somaliya i Elbaraf, hagati ya Shabelle."
mt0: <pad> The Somali Ministry of Foreign Affairs said on its Facebook page: "The government of the Republic of Somalia condemns with all possible force the evil attack that has been launched on the UN peacekeeping mission in Somalia in Elbaraf, between Shabelle."</s>

en: "We extend our deepest condolences to the victims of this terrorist attack and their families."
kin: Twihanganishije cyane abahuye n'ingaruka n'iki gitero cy'iterabwoba n'imiryango yabo.
mt0: <pad> We are deeply saddened by the victims of this terrorist attack and their families.</s>

en: The Mayor of El-Baraf, Abdullahi Haji Muhumed, said the militants started their attack with two suicide truck bombs. He said the militants then fought their way onto the base.
kin: Umuyobozi w'akarere ka El-Baraf, Abdullahi Haji Muhumed, yavuze ko aba barwanyi batangiye kugaba ibitero bakoresheje bisasu bibiri by'amakamyo. Yavuze ko abarwanashyaka bahise barwanira mu birindiro.
mt0: <pad> The militants launched a series of attacks on the village of El-Baraf in the north of the country.</s>

en: Al-Shabab claimed the killing of 173 African Union forces. The group also claimed responsibility for capturing AU forces as prisoners-of-war. Both claims could not be independently verified. AU force headquarters and Somali military officials could not be immediately reached for comment.
kin: Al-Shabab yatangaje ko hapfuye ingabo 173 z’umuryango w’ubumwe bw’Afurika. Uyu mutwe kandi wavuze ko ufite inshingano zo gufata ingabo za AU nk'imfungwa z'intambara. Ibyo birego byombi ntibishobora kugenzurwa mu bwigenge. Icyicaro gikuru cy’ingabo za AU hamwe n’abayobozi b’igisirikare cya Somaliya ntibashoboye guhita batanga ibisobanuro.
mt0: <pad> Al-Shabab claimed that 173 AU troops were killed. The group also said it was responsible for capturing AU troops as war prisoners. Those two allegations cannot be independently verified. The headquarters of the AU forces in Somalia and Somali military officials were unable to provide an immediate comment.</s>

en: In an interview with VOA, Muhumed, who was not at the village at the time of the attack, said he was told there were "many deaths" among Burundian forces but could not give an exact figure.
kin: Mu kiganiro yagiranye na VOA, Muhumed, utari mu mudugudu igihe igitero cyagabwaga, yavuze ko yabwiwe ko hari "imfu nyinshi" mu ngabo z’Uburundi ariko ko adashobora gutanga imibare nyayo.
mt0: <pad> In a conversation with VOA, Muhumed, who was not in the village when the attack occurred, said he was told there were "many dead" among the Burundian troops but that he cannot give exact figures.</s>

en: "Fighting like this never happened in this area," he said. "It was heavy fighting."
kin: Ati: "Imirwano nk'iyi ntabwo yigeze ibera muri kariya gace". Yari imirwano ikomeye.
mt0: <pad> He said: "Such a fight has never happened in that area. It was a very fierce fight.</s>

en: He said two civilians were also killed and more than 10 others injured.
kin: Yavuze ko abasivili babiri na bo bishwe abandi barenga 10 barakomereka.
mt0: <pad> He said two civilians were also killed and over 10 injured.</s>

en: Muhumed confirmed to VOA that al-Shabab militants withdrew from the base. He also reported airstrikes targeting the militants as they left the base but did not say who was responsible for the strikes.
kin: Muhumed yemeje VOA ko abarwanyi ba al-Shabab bavuye mu birindiro. Yavuze kandi ko ibitero by’indege byibasiye abarwanashyaka ubwo bavaga mu birindiro ariko ntiyavuze uwagize uruhare muri ibyo bitero.
mt0: <pad> Muhumed confirmed to VOA that al-Shabab fighters had left the base. He also said airstrikes hit the rebels as they were leaving the base, but did not say who was behind the airstrikes.</s>

en: El-Baraf, approximately 150 kilometers north of Mogadishu, is one of the forward operating bases of African Union forces from Burundi.
kin: El-Baraf, nko mu birometero 150 mu majyaruguru ya Mogadishu, ni kimwe mu birindiro by'ingabo z’umuryango w’ubumwe bw’ibihugu by’Uburayi ziba mu Burundi.
mt0: <pad> El-Baraf, about 150 kilometers north of Mogadishu, is one of the UN peacekeeping bases in Burundi.</s>

en: The incident marked the first major al-Shabab attack on AU forces since the mission changed its name and operational structures last month.
kin: Iki cyabaye igitero cya mbere gikomeye al-Shabab yagabye ku ngabo za AU kuva ubwo butumwa bwahinduye izina n'imikorere yabyo mu kwezi gushize.
mt0: <pad> This was the first major attack by al-Shabab on AU forces since the mission changed its name and mission last month.</s>

en: The U.N. Security Council, which authorized the new mission called the African Union Transition Mission in Somalia (ATMIS), gives it a mandate to reduce the threat posed by al-Shabab, support the capacity-building of Somali security forces, and conduct a phased handover of security responsibilities to Somalia. The mission has until the end of 2024 to operate in the country.
kin: Akanama k'umuryango w’abibumbye gashinzwe umutekano, kemereye ubutumwa bushya bwitwa Mission Union Transition Mission muri Somaliya (ATMIS), giha inshingano yo kugabanya iterabwoba ryatewe na al-Shabab, gushyigikira kongerera ubushobozi inzego z’umutekano za Somaliya. Hakozwe kandi ihererekanyabubasha ry’umutekano muri Somaliya. Inshingano ifite kugeza mu mpera za 2024 gukorera mu gihugu.
mt0: <pad> The UN Security Council has approved the new Mission Union Transition Mission in Somalia (ATMIS), which will reduce al-Shabab's terror, support and strengthen Somali security forces. It will also take over security in Somalia. The mission will be in place until the end of 2024.</s>

en: India’s Muslims Mark Eid al-Fitr Amid Community Violence
kin: Abayisilamu bo mu Buhinde bagize Eid al-Fitr mu gihe cy’ihohoterwa ry’abaturage
mt0: <pad> Muslims in India celebrate Eid al-Fitr during the violence of the people</s>

en: Muslims across India marked Eid al-Fitr on Tuesday by offering prayers outside mosques, even as the celebrations this year came in the backdrop of a series of recent attacks against the community during the month of Ramadan.
kin: Ku wa kabiri, Abayisilamu bo mu Buhinde bizihije umunsi mukuru wa Eid al-Fitr basengera hanze y’imisigiti, nubwo kwizihiza uyu mwaka byaje nyuma y’ibitero byibasiye abaturage mu kwezi kwa Ramadhan.
mt0: <pad> On Tuesday, Muslims in India celebrated Eid al-Fitr by praying outside mosques, although this year's festival came after the attack on the mosques during the month of Ramadhan.</s>

en: "We will not have the same kind of festivity" this time, said Mohammad Habeeb ur Rehman, a civil engineer in Indias financial capital, Mumbai. "This is the most painful Eid with worst memories for Indian Muslims."
kin: Mohammad Habeeb ur Rehman, umushakashatsi mu by'ubwubatsi mu murwa mukuru w'imari wa Indias, Mumbai, yagize ati: "Ntabwo tuzagira ibirori nk'ibyo." Uyu ni umunsi ukomeye ubabaza cyane twibuka abayisilamu bo mu Buhinde.
mt0: <pad> "We will never have such an event," said Mohammad Habeeb ur Rehman, a construction expert in India's Mumbai city. "This is a very sad day for the Muslim community in India."</s>

en: Anti-Muslim sentiment and attacks have surged across the country in the last month, including stone throwing between Hindu and Muslim groups during religious processions and subsequent demolitions of a number of properties mostly belonging to Muslims by authorities.
kin: Mu kwezi gushize imyumvire yo kurwanya abayisilamu n'ibitero byagaragaye hirya no hino mu gihugu, harimo gutera amabuye hagati y'amatsinda y'abahindu n'abayisilamu mu gihe cy'imyigaragambyo y'idini ndetse no gusenya imitungo myinshi ahanini yari iy'abayisilamu n'abayobozi.
mt0: <pad> Last month anti-Islamic sentiment and attacks were seen across the country, including stone throwing between Hindu and Muslim groups during religious protests and burning many properties mostly of Muslim and officials.</s>

en: The community, which makes up 14% of Indias 1.4 billion population, is reeling from vilification by hard-line Hindu nationalists who have long espoused an anti-Muslim stance. Some leaders of Indias ruling Hindu nationalist Bharatiya Janata Party have tacitly supported the violence, while Prime Minister Narendra Modi has so far been silent about it. Eid al-Fitr is typically marked with communal prayers, celebratory gatherings around festive meals and new clothes, but celebrations in India for the past two years have been marred by COVID-19 restrictions.
kin: Uyu muryango ugizwe na 14% by'abaturage ba Indias miliyari 1.4, bahangayikishijwe no gutukwa n’abenegihugu b’Abahindu bakomeye kuva kera bashyigikiye imyigaragambyo yo kurwanya Abayisilamu. Bamwe mu bayobozi b’ishyaka riri ku butegetsi ry’Abahindu baharanira inyungu z’Abahindu bashyigikiye byimazeyo ihohoterwa, mu gihe Minisitiri w’intebe Narendra Modi kugeza ubu acecetse. Ubusanzwe Eid al-Fitr irangwa n'amasengesho rusange, guterana kwizihiza amafunguro y'iminsi mikuru hamwe n'imyenda mishya, ariko ibirori mu Buhinde mu myaka ibiri ishize byarangijwe na COVID-19.
mt0: <pad> The Muslim community, which makes up 14% of India's 1.4 billion people, are concerned about the threats of violence by a large number of Hindu-nationalists who have long backed anti-Islam protests.</s>

en: In Indian-controlled Kashmir, the Muslim festival has been subdued for the past three years because of an unprecedented military lockdown after India stripped the regions semi-autonomy in 2019, followed by the pandemic. The region also saw a rise in violence during Ramadan, with at least 20 militants, two civilians and five police and soldiers killed.
kin: Mu mujyi wa Kashmir ugenzurwa n’Ubuhinde, iserukiramuco ry’abayisilamu rimaze imyaka itatu ryigaruriwe n’igitero kitigeze kibaho nyuma y’uko Ubuhinde bwambuye uturere igice cyigenga muri 2019, hagakurikiraho icyorezo. Muri ako karere kandi hagaragaye urugomo muri Ramazani, hapfa nibura abarwanyi 20, abasivili babiri n'abapolisi n'abasirikare batanu.
mt0: <pad> In Indian-administered Kashmir, an Islamic festival for the last three years was marred by a terrorist attack that has not been seen since India seized the region in 2019, followed by a pandemic.</s>

en: "As we prepare to celebrate Eid, a strong sense of collective loss jars at us," said Bashir Ahmed, a businessman in Srinagar.
kin: Umucuruzi muri Srinagar, Bashir Ahmed yagize ati: "Mu gihe twitegura kwizihiza umunsi mukuru wa Eid, twumva ko ari ibibindi byuzuye igihombo kuri twe."
mt0: <pad> "We are preparing to celebrate Eid, but we feel it is something full of danger for us," said a Srinagar businessman, Bashir Ahmed.</s>

en: Kashmir is the Muslim-majority disputed region where a violent insurgency against Indian rule and New Delhis brutal crackdown has raged for over three decades. Tens of thousands of people have died in the conflict.
kin: Kashmir ni agace kagizwe n’abayisilamu aho usanga inyeshyamba zikaze ku butegetsi bw’Ubuhinde ndetse n’igitero simusiga cya New Delhis kimaze imyaka isaga mirongo itatu. Abantu ibihumbi mirongo bapfiriye muri iyo ntambara.
mt0: <pad> Kashmir is an Islamist region where there are fierce rebellions against the Indian government and a serious attack by New Delhis for over thirty years. Thousands of people have died in this war.</s>

en: Meanwhile in the capital, New Delhi, hundreds assembled in the Jama Masjid, one of Indias largest mosques, while offering Eid prayers there for the first time in over two years due to pandemic restrictions. Families came together early on Tuesday morning while many people shared hugs and wishes.
kin: Hagati aho, mu murwa mukuru, New Delhi, abantu babarirwa mu magana bateraniye i Jama Masjid, umwe mu misigiti minini ya Indias, mu gihe basengaga umunsi mukuru wa Noheri ku nshuro yabo ya mbere mu myaka irenga ibiri kubera inzitizi z’ibyorezo. Imiryango yateraniye kare mugitondo cyo kuwa kabiri mugihe abantu benshi basangiye guhobera no kwifuriza.
mt0: <pad> While in the capital, New Delhi, about 100 people gathered at Jama Masjid, one of India's biggest mosques, as they prayed for the first time in over two years for the Eid holiday because of the pandemic restrictions. Families gathered early on Tuesday morning as many people gathered to greet and wish each other on the day of Eid.</s>

en: Beijing Residents Brace for COVID-19 Lockdown
kin: Abatuye Beijing bitegura Gumamurugo kubera COVID-19
mt0: <pad> Beijing residents preparing to stay at home due to the coronavirus</s>

en: Unlike Shanghai, Beijing has yet to require that all its residents remain at home to contain the spread of COVID-19. Nevertheless, many people in its Chaoyang district and elsewhere are preparing for that possibility.
kin: Bitandukanye na Shanghai, Beijing ntisaba ko abaturage bayo bose baguma mu rugo kugira ngo birinde COVID-19. Nubwo bimeze bityo ariko, abantu benshi mu karere kayo ka Chaoyang n'ahandi barimo kwitegura ku buryo bushoboka.
mt0: <pad> Unlike Shanghai, Beijing doesn't ask its citizens to stay home to prevent COVID-19. However, many people in its Chaoyang district and elsewhere are preparing as best they can.</s>

en: On Wednesday, city officials closed 60 subway stations, more than 10% of Beijing's vast system. They did not say when service would be resumed, according to ABC News.
kin: Ku wa gatatu, abayobozi b'umugi bafunze gari ya moshi 60, zirenga 10% bya sisitemu ngari ya Beijing. Ntibavuze igihe serivisi izasubukurirwa nk'uko ABC News ibitangaza.
mt0: <pad> On Wednesday, Beijing authorities closed 60 trains, over 10% of the city's transit system. They did not say when the service will be resumed, ABC News reported.</s>

en: Beijing, a city of 21 million people, has been on high alert for the spread of COVID-19, as restaurants and bars pivot to takeout, gyms close and schools suspend classes indefinitely, according to CNBC.
kin: Nk’uko CNBC ibitangaza, umujyi wa Beijing, umujyi utuwe na miliyoni 21, wakomeje kuba maso kugira ngo COVID-19 ikwirakwizwe, kubera ko amaresitora n'utubari bikurwaho, siporo zirafunga ndetse n'amashuri ahagarika amasomo mu gihe kitazwi.
mt0: <pad> As CNBC reports, Beijing, a city of 21 million people, has been taking measures to prevent the spread of COVID-19, as restaurants and bars are shut down, sports facilities are closed and schools have suspended classes for an unspecified time.</s>

en: People who live in "controlled" areas, neighborhoods where cases have been discovered, have been told to stay in the city, and all residents must test for the virus three times throughout the week, according to ABC.
kin: Nk’uko ABC ibitangaza, abantu baba mu duce "tugenzurwa", mu duce twagaragayemo ibibazo, basabwe kuguma mu mujyi, kandi abaturage bose bagomba kwipimisha virusi mu cyumweru cyose.
mt0: <pad> As ABC reports, people living in "controlled" areas, in the areas where problems have occurred, are being urged to stay in the city, and all residents are being tested for the virus every week.</s>

en: Chinese authorities reported 5,489 cases nationwide on Wednesday, of which 4,982 were in Shanghai, which has been under a draconian lockdown for weeks.
kin: Ku wa gatatu, abategetsi b'Abashinwa bavuze ko abantu 5489 mu gihugu hose, muri bo 4982 bari i Shanghai, bamaze ibyumweru byinshi bifunzwe.
mt0: <pad> On Wednesday, Chinese authorities said that 5489 people across the country, including 4982 in Shanghai, had been held for several weeks.</s>

en: Beijing reported 46 symptomatic cases and five asymptomatic on Wednesday. The city's total since April 22, what it considers the start of its omicron outbreak, is 544.
kin: Ku wa gatatu, Pekin yatangaje ibibazo 46 by'ibimenyetso na bitanu bidafite ibimenyetso. Umujyi wose kuva 22 Mata, icyo ubona ko ari intangiriro yicyorezo cyawo, ni 544.
mt0: <pad> On Wednesday, Pekin reported 46 symptomatic cases and five non-symptomatic cases. The total number of cases in the city since 22 May, which is the start of its outbreak, is 544.</s>

en: Mr. Zhang, a Beijing resident, said he had bought extra food and water, even though he doesn't think Beijing will be locked down like Shanghai. He asked that VOA not use his full name because he was afraid of attracting official attention.
kin: Bwana Zhang utuye i Beijing, yavuze ko yaguze ibiryo n'amazi by'inyongera, nubwo adatekereza ko Beijing izafungwa nka Shanghai. Yasabye ko VOA idakoresha izina rye ryuzuye kuko yatinyaga gukurura abayobozi.
mt0: <pad> Mr Zhang, who lives in Beijing, said he bought extra food and water, although he did not think that Beijing would be shut down like Shanghai. He asked VOA not to use his full name because he was afraid to attract attention from the authorities.</s>

en: "I have six bags of rice, two bags of noodles, and several boxes of water, instant noodles and (nutritionally dense) biscuits, and I haven't stocked up too much," Zhang told VOA Mandarin in a phone interview last week. He said he bought his groceries online because the supermarket was crowded.
kin: Mu cyumweru gishize, Zhang yatangarije VOA Mandarin ati: "Mfite imifuka itandatu y'umuceri, imifuka ibiri ya noode, hamwe n'amasanduku menshi y'amazi, isafuriya ihita hamwe na biscuits (byuzuye intungamubiri), kandi sinigeze mbika byinshi".Yavuze ko yaguze ibyo kurya kuri interineti kubera ko supermarket yari yuzuye.
mt0: <pad> Last week, Zhang told VOA Mandarin: "I have six bags of rice, two bags of noodles, and many boxes of water, a hot plate and biscuits (full of nutrients), and I haven't had much to wear". He said he bought food online because the supermarket was full.</s>

en: Ms. Yao, who lives in the Chaoyang district, told VOA Mandarin that she had been stocking up on necessities since the beginning of this year, after the Ministry of Commerce recommended that everyone do so. She asked that VOA Mandarin not use her full name because she wanted to avoid official retribution.
kin: Madamu Yao utuye mu karere ka Chaoyang, yatangarije VOA Mandarin ko yabitse ibikenerwa kuva mu ntangiriro z'uyu mwaka, nyuma y'uko Minisiteri y'Ubucuruzi ibasabye ko buri wese yabikora. Yasabye ko VOA Mandarin idakoresha izina rye ryuzuye kuko yashakaga kwirinda ibihano byemewe.
mt0: <pad> Ms. Yao, who lives in the Chaoyang district, told VOA Mandarin that she has been keeping her supplies since early this year, after the ministry of trade urged everyone to do so. She asked that VOA Mandarin not use her full name because she wanted to avoid legal action.</s>

en: "I have always maintained a good habit of reserving food. So I have a lot of rice, noodles and oil at home," she said, adding that she figured her family would be fine even if Beijing locked down for a month.
kin: Ati: "Nahoraga ngira akamenyero keza ko kubika ibiryo. Mfite rero umuceri, isafuriya n'amavuta mu rugo", akomeza avuga ko yasanze umuryango we uzaba mwiza nubwo Beijing yafunzwe ukwezi.
mt0: <pad> "I've always been good at cooking. I have rice, salt and oil in my house," she said.</s>

en: And while Beijing has not yet closed the city, citizens' lives have been disrupted.
kin: Mu gihe kandi Beijing itarafunga umujyi, ubuzima bw’abaturage bwahurangabanye.
mt0: <pad> Before Beijing was shut down, the city's life was already in shambles.</s>

en: On April 28, the Beijing Chaoyang District Maternal and Child Health Care Hospital issued a notice that the outpatient and emergency departments of the hospital would suspend the admission of patients.
kin: Ku ya 28 Mata, ibitaro byita ku buzima bw’ababyeyi n’abana bo mu karere ka Beijing Chaoyang byasohoye itangazo rivuga ko ishami ry’ibitaro n’ubutabazi by’ibitaro bizahagarika kwakira abarwayi.
mt0: <pad> On 28th April, the Beijing Chaoyang Children's Health Care Hospital published a statement saying that the hospital and the first aid department of the hospital will stop accepting patients.</s>

en: On the same day, Chaoyang Hospital, one of the largest hospitals in Beijing, announced on its official Weibo account that its emergency department would also suspend the admission of patients. Weibo is China's equivalent of Twitter.
kin: Kuri uwo munsi, ibitaro bya Chaoyang, kimwe mu bitaro binini i Beijing, byatangaje ku rubuga rwayo rwa Weibo ko ishami ryihutirwa naryo rizahagarika kwakira abarwayi. Weibo nu Bushinwa bungana na Twitter.
mt0: <pad> On the same day, Chaoyang Hospital, one of the biggest hospitals in Beijing, announced on its Weibo website that its emergency department will also stop accepting patients. Weibo is China's equivalent of Twitter.</s>

en: Angry Chinese netizens left more than 800 messages under the official WeChat account "Beijing Headline."
kin: Abashinwa bafite umujinya mwinshi basize ubutumwa burenga 800 munsi ya konte ya WeChat "Umutwe wa Beijing."
mt0: <pad> Chinese angry people left over 800 messages under the WeChat account "Beijing Headquarters"</s>

en: "Why do you stop the emergency room as soon as there is a new COVID case, and how many people will be killed due to the secondary disaster caused by the COVID?" a netizen asked in a Weibo post.
kin: "Kuki uhagarika icyumba cyihutirwa ukimara kubona ikibazo gishya cya COVID, kandi ni bangahe bazahitanwa n’impanuka ya kabiri yatewe na COVID?" umu netisen yabajije mu nyandiko ya Weibo.
mt0: <pad> "Why do you stop the emergency room after you see a new case of COVID, and how many people will die from the second COVID accident?" a netizen asked in a Weibo post.</s>

en: Some Beijing residents said they were not worried about a Shanghai-like lockdown.
kin: Bamwe mu baturage ba Beijing bavuze ko badahangayikishijwe no gufunga nka Shanghai.
mt0: <pad> Some Beijing residents said they were not worried about closing like Shanghai.</s>

en: "Basically, I'm not afraid," said Mr. Wang, who asked VOA Mandarin to not use his full name so he could avoid attracting authorities' attention. "The party, government and military are here, and the people are here."
kin: Bwana Wang wasabye VOA Mandarin kudakoresha izina rye ryuzuye kugira ngo yirinde gukurura abayobozi. Ati: "Muri rusange, ntabwo ntinya." Ishyaka, guverinoma n'abasirikare bari hano, kandi abaturage bari hano.
mt0: <pad> Wang asked VOA Mandarin not to use his full name to avoid attracting attention from the Chinese authorities. He said: "In general, I don't fear." The party, government and military are here, and the people are here.</s>

en: However, Wang told VOA Mandarin, in mid-October last year, after one person in his apartment building was diagnosed as positive, about 600 people from more than 200 families were forced into isolation at several hotels in the Changping district for 21 days.
kin: Icyakora, Wang yabwiye VOA Mandarin, ko hagati mu Kwakira umwaka ushize, nyuma yuko basanze umuntu umwe mu nyubako ye afite icyiza, abantu bagera kuri 600 bo mu miryango irenga 200 bahatiwe kwigunga mu mahoteri menshi yo mu karere ka Changping mu gihe cy'iminsi 21.
mt0: <pad> But Wang told VOA Mandarin that in mid-October last year, after one of his neighbors was found to be infected, 600 people from over 200 families were forced to isolate in several hotels in Changping for days after a person in their building was found to be infected.</s>

en: Wang and his wife were not allowed to share a room at their hotel.
kin: Wang n'umugore we ntibari bemerewe gusangira icyumba muri hoteri yabo.
mt0: <pad> Wang and his wife were not allowed to share a room in their hotel.</s>

en: What particularly puzzled and annoyed Wang was that on the last day of the mandatory hotel quarantine, in addition to routine nasal and oral swabs during testing, authorities added anal swabs to the regimen.
kin: Icyatangaje cyane kandi cyarakaje Wang ni uko ku munsi wanyuma wa karantine ya hoteri iteganijwe, usibye kwizuru ryamazuru hamwe n'umunwa mu gihe cyo kwipimisha, abayobozi bongeyeho anal kuri rejime.
mt0: <pad> The most surprising and shocking thing for Wang was that on the last day of the hotel quarantine, in addition to washing the nose and mouth during the check-up, the authorities added anal to the regime.</s>

en: Kasim Abdurehim contributed to this report.
kin: Kasim Abdurehim yagize uruhare muri iyi raporo.
mt0: <pad> Kasim Abdurehim played a role in this report.</s>

en: At US Urging, Fiji Seizes Russian Oligarch’s Yacht
kin: Muri Amerika babisabye, Fiji Yafashe Yacht ya Oligarch yo mu Burusiya.
mt0: <pad> Fiji has seized the Yacht of a Russian oligarch.</s>

en: Another Russian oligarchs yacht was seized Thursday as part of efforts to punish Russia over its war in Ukraine.
kin: Indi yacht yo mu Burusiya yafashwe mu rwego rwo guhana Uburusiya kubera intambara yabereye muri Ukraine.
mt0: <pad> Russia's second yacht was seized in order to punish Russia for the war in Ukraine.</s>

en: At the request of the United States, Fijian officials took a $300 million yacht belonging to Suleiman Kerimov, the Justice Department said. Officials say the yacht is in Lautoka, Fiji.
kin: Ishami ry’ubutabera rivuga ko bisabwe n’Amerika, abayobozi ba Fijiyani batwaye ubwato bwa miliyoni 300 z’amadolari ya Suleiman Kerimov. Abayobozi bavuga ko ubwato buri i Lautoka, muri Fiji.
mt0: <pad> The Justice Department said that on the request of the United States, Fijian authorities seized Suleiman Kerimov's 300 million-dollar ship. Authorities say the ship is in Lautoka, Fiji.</s>

en: Kerimovs yacht, the Cayman Island-flagged Amadea, reportedly has been in Fiji since last month, arriving from Mexico. Defense lawyers claimed the vessel belonged to another oligarch.
kin: Yacht Kerimovs, ikirwa cya Cayman Flagged Amadea, bivugwa ko ari muri Fiji kuva mu kwezi gushize, ageze muri Mexico. Abunganira abaregwa bavuze ko ubwo bwato ari ubwa oligarch.
mt0: <pad> The Yacht Kerimovs, a Cayman Islands-flagged Amadea, is said to have been in Fiji since last month, and arrived in Mexico. Prosecutors said the ship belonged to an oligarch.</s>

en: Kerimov had already been sanctioned by the U.S. in 2014 and 2018 for Russias activities in Syria and Ukraine. The European Union also sanctioned him.
kin: Kerimov yari amaze kwemererwa na Amerika muri 2014 na 2018 kubera ibikorwa by'Uburusiya muri Siriya na Ukraine. Umuryango w’ubumwe bw’ibihugu by’i Burayi na we wamwemereye.
mt0: <pad> Kerimov had already been recognised by the US in 2014 and 2018 for his role in Russia's activities in Syria and Ukraine. The European Union also recognised him.</s>

en: In March, the U.S. government announced a comprehensive effort to identify and seize the assets of wealthy Russians who have supported the government of Russian President Vladmir Putin, as part of the response to Moscows February 24 invasion of Ukraine.
kin: Muri Werurwe, guverinoma y’Amerika yatangaje ko hashyizweho ingufu mu kumenya no gufata umutungo w’Abarusiya bakize bashyigikiye guverinoma ya Perezida w’Uburusiya Vladmir Putin, mu rwego rwo gusubiza i Moscou igitero cyo ku ya 24 Gashyantare.
mt0: <pad> In March, the U.S. government announced that it had put a special focus on identifying and seizing Russian rich supporters of President Vladimir Putin's government, in order to retaliate to the attack on Moscou on 24 February.</s>

en: The initiative, led by the Justice Department, is called Task Force KleptoCapture.
kin: Iyi gahunda iyobowe n’ishami ry’ubutabera, yitwa Task Force KleptoCapture.
mt0: <pad> The program is led by the Department of Justice, Task Force KleptoCapture.</s>

en: U.S. Attorney General Merrick Garland said Thursday in a statement there is "no hiding place for the assets of criminals who enable the Russian regime." He also said, "The Justice Department will be relentless in our efforts to hold accountable those who facilitate the death and destruction we are witnessing in Ukraine."
kin: Ku wa kane, umushinjacyaha mukuru wa Leta zunze ubumwe za Amerika, Merrick Garland, yatangaje ko "nta hantu hihishe umutungo w’abagizi ba nabi bashoboza ubutegetsi bw’Uburusiya." Yavuze kandi ati: "Ishami ry’Ubutabera ntirizahwema gushyira ingufu mu kuryozwa aborohereza urupfu n’irimbuka tubona muri Ukraine."
mt0: <pad> On Thursday, the United States attorney general Merrick Garland said that "there is no hiding place for the assets of Russian-backed rebels." He also said: "The Department of Justice will not stop working to prosecute those who allow the death and destruction we see in Ukraine."</s>

en: In April, at the urging of the U.S., Spanish authorities seized a yacht belonging to Russian oligarch Viktor Vekselberg, the owner of the Russian conglomerate Renova Group.
kin: Muri Mata, abisabwe na Amerika, abategetsi ba Espagne bafashe ubwato bwa oligarch yo mu Burusiya Viktor Vekselberg, nyiri itsinda ry’Abarusiya Renova Group.
mt0: <pad> In May, at the request of the United States, Spanish authorities seized the ship of Russian oligarch Viktor Vekselberg, owner of the Russian Renova Group.</s>

en: Last week, the U.S. House of Representatives passed a measure that would allow the U.S. government to sell forfeited Russian properties worth more than $2 million for the benefit of Ukraine. The measures next step is the Senate.
kin: Mu cyumweru gishize, Inteko ishinga amategeko y’Amerika yemeje ingamba zemerera guverinoma y’Amerika kugurisha imitungo y’Uburusiya yatakaye ifite agaciro ka miliyoni zirenga 2 z’inyungu za Ukraine. Ingamba zikurikira ni Sena.
mt0: <pad> Last week, the U.S. House of Representatives approved measures allowing the U.S. government to sell Russia's assets worth over 2 million dollars in Ukraine interests. The next step is the Senate.</s>

en: (Some information in this report comes from Reuters.)
kin: (Amakuru amwe muri iyi raporo aturuka muri Reuters.)
mt0: <pad> (Some of the information in this report comes from Reuters.)</s>

en: WHO Report Says COVID Cases Decline, Except in Americas, Africa
kin: Raporo ya OMS ivuga ko Imanza za COVID zigabanuka, Usibye muri Amerika, Afurika
mt0: <pad> The WHO report said that the number of COVID-19 cases fell, except in America, Africa.</s>

en: The World Health Organization said Wednesday that the number of newly reported coronavirus cases and deaths globally continued to fall in the last week, continuing a decline that began in March.
kin: Ku wa gatatu, Ishami ry'Umuryango w'Abibumbye ryita ku Buzima ryatangaje ko umubare w'abantu banduye coronavirus n'impfu zavuzwe ku isi wakomeje kugabanuka mu cyumweru gishize, bikomeza kugabanuka byatangiye muri Werurwe.
mt0: <pad> The number of coronavirus cases and deaths reported around the world has continued to decline in the past week, continuing the downward trend that began in March.</s>

en: In its weekly report on the pandemic, the U.N. health agency said there were about 3.8 million new infections and more than 15,000 deaths last week, a 17% and 3% drop on the week respectively. But those figures are believed to be a significant underestimate of COVID-19's true toll as increasing numbers of countries abandon widespread testing and surveillance.
kin: Muri raporo y’icyumweru ivuga ku cyorezo, ikigo cy’ubuzima cya Leta zunze ubumwe z’Amerika cyavuze ko mu cyumweru gishize hari abantu bashya bagera kuri miliyoni 3.8 n’impfu zirenga 15.000, icyumweru 17% na 3% bikagabanuka. Ariko iyo mibare ngo ni ugusuzugura cyane umubare wa COVID-19 kuko umubare w’ibihugu ugenda ureka kwipimisha no kugenzura.
mt0: <pad> In its weekly report on the pandemic, the U.S. Centers for Disease Control said there were 3.8 million new cases and over 15,000 deaths last week, a reduction of 17% and 3% respectively. But those figures are being underestimated by the number of countries that are dropping tests and testing for COVID-19 because they are losing the habit of testing and testing.</s>

en: Still, WHO noted that cases rose by about a third in Africa and 13% in the Americas. There was also a nearly 70% jump in deaths reported in India, although that was attributed to delayed reporting rather than a recent surge of disease.
kin: Ninde, OMS yavuze ko imanza ziyongereyeho kimwe cya gatatu muri Afurika na 13% muri Amerika. Habayeho kandi gusimbuka hafi 70% by'impfu zavuzwe mu Buhinde, nubwo ibyo byatewe no gutinda gutanga raporo aho kuba indwara ziherutse kwiyongera.
mt0: <pad> The WHO said that the cases increased by one-third in Africa and 13% in America. There was also a 70% drop in deaths reported in India, although this is likely to be due to a delayed report rather than the recent surge of the disease.</s>

en: Last week, authorities in South Africa said they had noted an uptick in COVID-19 cases attributable to the BA.4 mutant of omicron, although they said it was too early to tell if that would result in a significant new wave of disease. Although the BA.4 version of COVID-19's omicron variant appears more infectious than omicron, WHO said there was no evidence yet that it was leading to substantially higher rates of hospitalization or death.
kin: Mu cyumweru gishize, abategetsi bo muri Afurika yepfo bavuze ko babonye ikibazo cya COVID-19 cyatewe na BA.4 mutant ya omicron, nubwo bavuze ko hakiri kare kumenya niba ibyo byavamo indwara nshya. Nubwo verisiyo ya BA.4 ya COVID-19 ya omicron isa nkaho yanduye kurusha omicron, OMS yavuze ko nta kimenyetso cyerekana ko biganisha ku mubare munini w’ibitaro cyangwa urupfu.
mt0: <pad> Last week, South African authorities said they had identified a case of COVID-19 caused by the mutant variant of omicron's BA.4, although they said it was too early to know if that could be a new disease. Although the BA.4 variant of omicron's COVID-19 seems to be more infectious than omicron, the OMS said there was no indication that it would lead to a large number of hospitalizations or deaths.</s>

en: Salim Abdool Karim, a public health expert at the University of KwaZulu-Natal, said that while only a "modest" rise in cases had been noted, South Africa was also in the middle of a holiday period and testing had dropped significantly. He said the cases were slowing and were "not following a rocket-like upward trajectory we would expect" in another spike of disease.
kin: Salim Abdool Karim, impuguke mu buzima rusange muri kaminuza ya KwaZulu-Natal, yavuze ko mu gihe hagaragaye ubwiyongere bukabije mu manza, Afurika yepfo nayo yari mu kiruhuko kandi ikizamini cyaragabanutse cyane. Yavuze ko imanza zidindiza kandi ko "zidakurikiza inzira ya roketi imeze nk'izamuka hejuru".
mt0: <pad> Salim Abdool Karim, a professor of public health at the University of KwaZulu-Natal, said that the increase in cases was not "rocket-like" and that the test had been cut down.</s>

en: At a press briefing on Wednesday, WHO emergencies chief Dr. Michael Ryan said it was too soon to tell if COVID-19 was entering a seasonal pattern and warned against countries dropping all of their restrictions too quickly — as many in the West have done.
kin: Ku wa gatatu, mu kiganiro n'abanyamakuru, umuyobozi mukuru w’ibihe bidasanzwe muri OMS, Dr. Michael Ryan, yavuze ko bidatinze kumenya niba COVID-19 yinjiye mu bihe by’ibihe kandi akanaburira ibihugu kureka ibyo bibuza byose - nk'uko benshi mu Burengerazuba babikoze.
mt0: <pad> On Wednesday, in a press conference, the head of the WHO's emergency department Dr. Michael Ryan said it was too early to know if COVID-19 had entered a pandemic and urged countries to abandon all measures - as many in the West have done.</s>

en: "The jury is still out as to how seasonal this virus will become," he said, explaining that it wasn't proven yet that COVID-19 would naturally drop off in the summer and that the world could yet face more unsettling variants. "If people are crowded together in conditions where a new variant is spreading, you will see high levels of transmission," he said.
kin: Ati: "Inteko y'abacamanza iracyareba uko iyi virusi izagenda iba ibihe", asobanura ko bitaragaragaye neza ko COVID-19 izagwa mu mpeshyi kandi ko isi ishobora guhura n'ibindi bintu bitesha umutwe. Ati: "Niba abantu bateraniye hamwe mu bihe aho usanga ubundi buryo bushya bukwirakwira, uzabona ubwinshi bwo kwandura."
mt0: <pad> "If people are gathered together during times when there is another form of transmission, you will see a greater number of infections," he said.</s>

en: Meanwhile in China, authorities continued to crack down on cities, including Beijing, where more than 10% of the subway system was shut down in an effort to curb the virus' spread, after authorities in the capital already closed down indoor dining, gyms and school classes.
kin: Hagati aho, mu Bushinwa, abayobozi bakomeje guhashya imijyi, harimo na Beijing, aho abantu barenga 10% bya sisitemu ya metero zafunzwe mu rwego rwo gukumira virusi ikwirakwizwa, nyuma y’uko abayobozi mu murwa mukuru bamaze gufunga ibyokurya byo mu ngo, siporo ndetse amasomo y'ishuri.
mt0: <pad> While in China, authorities continue to quarantine cities, including Beijing, where over 10% of the metro system has been closed to prevent the spread of the virus, after the capital's authorities have closed home food, sports and school classes to curb the spread of the virus.</s>

en: In Shanghai, rigid and widely derided restrictions have led to shortages of food and medical aid along with a wider — though likely temporary — impact on the national economy. Desperate, outraged citizens have confronted authorities at barricades and online, screamed out of their windows and banged pots and pans in a sign of frustration and anger.
kin: Muri Shanghai, imbogamizi zikomeye kandi zisebya abantu benshi zatumye ibura ry'ibiribwa n'inkunga z'ubuvuzi hamwe n’ingaruka nini nubwo zishobora kuba iz'igihe gito - ku bukungu bw'igihugu. Abaturage bihebye, bararakaye bahanganye n'abayobozi kuri bariyeri no kuri interineti, bavuza induru bava mu madirishya maze bakubita inkono n'amasafuriya mu rwego rwo kwiheba n'uburakari.
mt0: <pad> In Shanghai, serious and destructive obstacles caused shortages of food and medical aid, and large impacts - even if only for a short time - on the national economy. People were desperate, angry, clashed with authorities on barricades and online, shouted from windows and banged their fingers and spoons to show their discontent and anger.</s>

en: Myanmar Supreme Court Rejects Aung San Suu Kyi Appeal on Corruption Charges
kin: Urukiko rw'Ikirenga rwa Miyanimari rwanze ubujurire bwa Aung San Suu Kyi ku byaha aregwa bya ruswa
mt0: <pad> The Myanmar Supreme Court refused to hear Aung San Suu Kyi's appeal against the charges of graft.</s>

en: An appeal of a five-year jail sentence against ousted Myanmar leader Aung San Suu Kyi was rejected Wednesday by the country's supreme court.
kin: Ku wa gatatu, urukiko rw’ikirenga rw’igihugu rwanze ubujurire bw’igifungo cy’imyaka 5 ku muyobozi wa Miyanimari wirukanwe Aung San Suu Kyi.
mt0: <pad> On Wednesday, the country's highest court refused to hear the appeal of the exiled Myanmar leader Aung San Suu Kyi's five-year jail term.</s>

en: The decision reportedly came as soon as the claim for an appeal was lodged, and the court didn't entertain arguments from either side in the case.
kin: Iki cyemezo ngo cyafashwe akimara gutanga ikirego mu bujurire, kandi urukiko ntirwakiriye impaka ku mpande zombi muri uru rubanza.
mt0: <pad> He says the decision was made after he filed his appeal, and the court did not accept both sides' argument in this case.</s>

en: Suu Kyi, 76, was sentenced last week after being found guilty of 11 counts of corruption, including taking a bribe of cash and gold bars worth $600,000.
kin: Mu cyumweru gishize, Suu Kyi, yakatiwe nyuma yo guhamwa n'ibyaha 11 bya ruswa, birimo gufata ruswa y'amafaranga n'utubari twa zahabu bifite agaciro ka $ 600,000.
mt0: <pad> Last week, Suu Kyi was convicted of 11 corruption charges, including money and gold bars worth $600,000.</s>

en: Her lawyer called the charge absurd.
kin: Umwunganizi we yavuze ko ikirego kitumvikana.
mt0: <pad> His lawyer said that the case was unreasonable.</s>

en: Suu Kyi had already been sentenced to six years for actions against the military, breaking COVID-19 rules and breaking a telecommunications law.
kin: Suu Kyi yari amaze gukatirwa imyaka itandatu kubera ibikorwa byo kurwanya igisirikare, kurenga ku mategeko ya COVID-19 no kurenga ku itegeko ry'itumanaho.
mt0: <pad> Suu Kyi had been jailed for six years for anti-military activities, breaches of the COVID-19 law and breaches of the communication law.</s>

en: She faces many more charges, and if found guilty could be sentenced to more than 150 years in jail.
kin: Akurikiranyweho ibindi byaha byinshi, kandi aramutse ahamwe n'icyaha ashobora gukatirwa imyaka irenga 150.
mt0: <pad> He is also being investigated for many other crimes, and if convicted he could be sentenced to more than 150 years in prison.</s>

en: Suu Kyi has been under house arrest since a military coup took over the country last year.
kin: Suu Kyi afungiye mu rugo kuva ihirikwa ry’abasirikare ryigarurira igihugu umwaka ushize.
mt0: <pad> Suu Kyi has been in house arrest since the military coup that overthrew her last year.</s>

en: Since the coup, on Feb. 1, 2021, there have been widespread protests against the military regime. The regime cracked down violently in many cases, leaving more than 1,800 civilians dead and more than 10,000 arrested, charged or sentenced, according to the Assistance Association for Political Prisoners (Burma).
kin: Kuva ihirikwa ry’ubutegetsi, ku ya 1 Gashyantare 2021, habaye imyigaragambyo yo kwamagana ubutegetsi bwa gisirikare. Ishyirahamwe rifasha imfungwa za politiki (Birimaniya) rivuga ko ubwo butegetsi bwahagurukiye mu buryo bwinshi, hasigara abasivili barenga 1.800 abandi barenga 10,000 batawe muri yombi, bakurikiranyweho cyangwa bakatirwa.
mt0: <pad> Since the coup, on 1 February 2021, there have been protests against the military rule. The German Political Prisoners' Association (German) says that the regime has become much more brutal, with over 1,800 civilians still alive and over 10,000 arrested, prosecuted or sentenced.</s>

en: Some information in this report comes from Reuters and Agence France-Presse.
kin: Amakuru amwe muri iyi raporo aturuka muri Reuters na Agence France-Presse.
mt0: <pad> Some of the information in this report comes from Reuters and Agence France-Presse.</s>

en: Foreign Tourists Begin Arriving in New Zealand After COVID Restrictions Lifted
kin: Ba mukerarugendo b'abanyamahanga batangiye kugera muri Nouvelle-Zélande Nyuma yo gukuraho COVID
mt0: <pad> Foreign tourists have begun to arrive in New Zealand after the removal of the restrictions.</s>

en: For the first time in over two years, overseas tourists have been allowed to enter New Zealand starting Monday.
kin: Bwa mbere mu myaka irenga ibiri, ba mukerarugendo bo mu mahanga bemerewe kwinjira muri Nouvelle-Zélande guhera ku wa mbere.
mt0: <pad> For the first time in over two years, foreign tourists are allowed to enter New Zealand on Monday.</s>

en: The island nation known for its natural beauty enacted some of the strictest lockdown measures during the COVID-19 pandemic, including very restrictive travel limitations.
kin: Igihugu cyirwa kizwiho ubwiza nyaburanga cyashyizeho ingamba zikaze zo gufunga mugihe cyorezo cya COVID-19, harimo no kugabanya ingendo nke.
mt0: <pad> The island country known for its natural beauty has adopted strict measures to close during the COVID-19 pandemic, including reducing small travel.</s>

en: The country had reopened for tourists from Australia weeks ago, but the new relaxation of restrictions now allows tourists from over 60 countries to visit, including most European countries and the U.S.
kin: Igihugu cyari cyongeye gufungura ba mukerarugendo baturutse muri Ositaraliya mu byumweru bishize, ariko uburyo bushya bwo kugabanya imipaka ubu butuma ba mukerarugendo baturuka mu bihugu birenga 60 basura, harimo ibihugu byinshi by’Uburayi na Amerika.
mt0: <pad> The country had reopened to Australian tourists last week, but the new border-less system now allows visitors from over 60 countries to visit, including many European and American countries.</s>

en: "Today is a day to celebrate and is a big moment in our reconnection with the world," said Tourism Minister Stuart Nash.
kin: Minisitiri w’ubukerarugendo Stuart Nash ati: "Uyu munsi ni umunsi wo kwishimira kandi ni umwanya ukomeye mu kongera guhura n’isi".
mt0: <pad> The tourism minister Stuart Nash said: "Today is a day of thanks and a great time to reconnect with the world."</s>

en: Tourists must show they are fully vaccinated and test negative for the virus.
kin: Ba mukerarugendo bagomba kwerekana ko bakingiwe kandi bapima virusi.
mt0: <pad> Tourists must show they have been vaccinated and tested for the virus.</s>

en: Citizens of China, India and other countries not given a waiver Monday are still not allowed to visit.
kin: Abaturage bo mu Bushinwa, Ubuhinde ndetse n’ibindi bihugu batahawe uburenganzira bwo ku wa mbere ntibemerewe gusurwa.
mt0: <pad> Chinese, Indian and other citizens who did not receive an early permit are not allowed to visit.</s>

en: Before the pandemic, tourism accounted for 5% of the countrys economic activity and 20% of its foreign income.
kin: Mbere y’icyorezo, ubukerarugendo bwagize 5% by’ibikorwa by’ubukungu n’ibihugu 20% byinjira mu mahanga.
mt0: <pad> Before the pandemic, tourism accounted for 5% of the economy and 20% of the world's imports.</s>

en: On Monday, 43 international flights carrying around 9,000 passengers were scheduled to leave or arrive at Auckland International Airport, Reuters reported.
kin: Reuters yatangaje ko ku wa mbere, indege 43 mpuzamahanga zitwara abagenzi 9000 zari ziteganijwe guhaguruka cyangwa kugera ku kibuga cy’indege mpuzamahanga cya Auckland.
mt0: <pad> Reuters reported that on Monday, 43 international aircraft with 9000 passengers were scheduled to depart or land at the Auckland International Airport.</s>

en: Some information in this report comes from The Associated Press and Reuters.
kin: Some information in this report comes from The Associated Press and Reuters.
mt0: <pad> Some information in this report comes from The Associated Press and Reuters.</s>

en: Report: Iran to Execute Swedish-Iranian National by May 21
kin: Raporo: Irani izica igihugu cya Suwede-Irani bitarenze ku ya 21 Gicurasi
mt0: <pad> Report: Iran will destroy the Swedish-Iranian oil pipeline by May 21</s>

en: Iran will later this month execute a Swedish-Iranian national whom it has imprisoned since 2016 and convicted of spying for Israel, media reported.
kin: Ibitangazamakuru byatangaje ko Irani mu mpera z'uku kwezi izica umunyagihugu wa Suwede na Irani yafunzwe kuva mu 2016 kandi ahamwa n'icyaha cyo kuneka Isiraheli.
mt0: <pad> The Swedish and Iranian citizens were killed by Iran this month.</s>

en: Irans semiofficial ISNA news agency on Wednesday released a report in which Iranian officials stated that Tehran will implement the death penalty against Ahmad Reza Jalali by May 21.
kin: Kuri uyu wa gatatu, ibiro ntaramakuru ISNA bitanga amakuru kuri Irans byatangaje raporo aho abayobozi ba Irani bavuze ko Tehran izashyira mu bikorwa igihano cy'urupfu kuri Ahmad Reza Jalali bitarenze ku ya 21 Gicurasi.
mt0: <pad> On Wednesday, the ISNA news agency reported that Iran's officials said Tehran will put into effect the death sentence on Ahmad Reza Jalali by May 21.</s>

en: Jalali, a researcher and physician who specializes in disaster relief, was arrested during a visit to Iran in April 2016. In 2017, Jalali was sentenced to death in Iran after he had been found guilty of passing information about two Iranian nuclear scientists to Israel to help it assassinate several nuclear scientists.
kin: Jalali, umushakashatsi n’umuganga w’inzobere mu gutabara ibiza, yatawe muri yombi ubwo yari mu ruzinduko muri Irani muri Mata 2016. Muri 2017, Jalali yakatiwe urwo gupfa muri Irani nyuma yo guhamwa n’icyaha cyo kugeza amakuru kuri siyansi ebyiri za Irani muri Isiraheli fasha guhitana abahanga benshi ba kirimbuzi.
mt0: <pad> Jalali, a research scientist and expert in emergency medical care, was arrested while on a visit to Iran in April 2016. In 2017, he was sentenced to death in Iran after being convicted of passing information on two Iranian science to Israel which helped kill many Iranian nuclear scientists.</s>

en: Rights groups have condemned Jalalis detention, citing Irans pattern of detaining dual nationals and expatriates without due process.
kin: Imiryango iharanira uburenganzira bwa muntu yamaganye ifungwa rya Jalalis, ivuga ko Irans yo gufunga abenegihugu bombi ndetse n’ababa mu mahanga nta nzira iboneye.
mt0: <pad> Human rights groups have condemned the jailing of Jalalis, saying that Iran's practice of jailing both its nationals and foreigners is not a good way to handle dissent.</s>

en: Iran does not recognize dual nationals.
kin: Irani ntiyemera abenegihugu babiri.
mt0: <pad> Iran does not accept two-nationality.</s>

en: The announcement came as authorities in Stockholm wrapped up the trial of Hamid Nouri, a former Iranian prosecution official whom Swedish officials arrested in November 2019.
kin: Ibi byatangajwe mu gihe abayobozi i Stockholm bashoje urubanza rwa Hamid Nouri wahoze ari umushinjacyaha wa Irani, abayobozi ba Suwede bata muri yombi mu Gushyingo 2019.
mt0: <pad> The announcement was made as Stockholm authorities concluded the trial of Hamid Nouri, the former prosecutor of Iran, whom Swedish authorities arrested in November 2019.</s>

en: Authorities say Nouri played a role in the deaths of political prisoners executed on Iranian government orders at Irans Gohardasht prison during the final phase of the Iran-Iraq war in 1988. Nouri has been held in custody in Sweden since his arrest.
kin: Abayobozi bavuga ko Nouri yagize uruhare mu rupfu rw’imfungwa za politiki ziciwe ku itegeko rya guverinoma ya Irani muri gereza ya Irans Gohardasht mu cyiciro cya nyuma cy’intambara ya Irani na Iraki mu 1988. Nouri afungiye muri Suwede kuva yatabwa muri yombi.
mt0: <pad> Authorities say Nouri was involved in the killing of political prisoners executed by the Iranian government in Iran's Gohardasht prison in the last days of the Iran-Iraq war in 1988. Nouri has been held in Sweden since his arrest in the country.</s>

en: On Wednesday, the final day of Nouri's trial, a Stockholm district court judge set the date of the verdict for July 14.
kin: Ku wa gatatu, umunsi wa nyuma w’urubanza rwa Nouri, umucamanza w’urukiko rw’intara ya Stockholm yashyizeho itariki y’urubanza ku ya 14 Nyakanga.
mt0: <pad> On Wednesday, the last day of Nouri's trial, a judge at Stockholm County Court set the date for the hearing on 14 June.</s>

en: Amnesty International put the number of those executed at the prison at 5,000 but said in a 2018 report that the number could be higher.
kin: Amnesty International yashyize ahagaragara umubare w'abiciwe muri gereza ku 5.000 ariko muri raporo ya 2018 ivuga ko umubare ushobora kuba mwinshi.
mt0: <pad> Amnesty International estimates the number of prisoners killed at 5,000 but in its 2018 report it said that the number may be higher.</s>

en: Human Rights Watch, in a recent report, said, "Iran continues to be one of the worlds leading implementers of the death penalty."
kin: Human Rights Watch, muri raporo iherutse, yagize ati: "Irani ikomeje kuba umwe mu isi iyobora abashyira mu bikorwa igihano cy'urupfu."
mt0: <pad> Human Rights Watch, in its most recent report, said: "Iran remains one of the world's leading implementers of the death penalty."</s>

en: If Nouri is convicted, he will face a maximum life sentence on charges of international war crimes and human rights abuses. Iran recently summoned the Swedish envoy in protest over Nouris case.
kin: Nouri aramutse ahamwe n'icyaha, azahanishwa igifungo cya burundu ashinjwa ibyaha mpuzamahanga by'intambara no guhonyora uburenganzira bwa muntu. Irani iherutse guhamagara intumwa ya Suwede mu rwego rwo kwamagana ikibazo cya Nouris.
mt0: <pad> If convicted, Nouri will face life imprisonment for war crimes and human rights abuses. Iran has recently summoned the ambassador of Sweden to protest the case of Nouris.</s>

en: Maja Aberg, senior policy adviser with Amnesty International Sweden, says it is no coincidence that Iran announced Jalalis pending execution just after Swedish prosecutors moved on Nouris trial.
kin: Maja Aberg, umujyanama mukuru muri politiki muri Amnesty International Suwede, avuga ko bidahwitse ko Irani yatangaje Jalalis mu gihe hagitegerejwe kwicwa nyuma yuko abashinjacyaha ba Suwede bimukiye mu rubanza rwa Nouris.
mt0: <pad> Maja Aberg, a senior policy advisor at Amnesty International Sweden, said it was unfortunate that Iran announced Jalalis while he was still being held after the Swedish prosecutors refused to prosecute Nouris.</s>

en: "It indicates that (Iran) sees him as a kind of piece in the jigsaw puzzle, which is very worrying," Aberg told Sweden's TT news agency.
kin: Aberg yatangarije ibiro ntaramakuru TT byo muri Suwede ati: "Byerekana ko (Irani) imubona nk'igice cyo mu gihirahiro, biteye impungenge cyane."
mt0: <pad> Aberg told the Swedish news agency TT: "This shows that Iran sees him as part of the puzzle, which is very worrying."</s>

en: Swedish law allows for the prosecution of Swedish citizens and other nationals for crimes against international law committed abroad.
kin: Amategeko ya Suwede yemerera gukurikirana abenegihugu ba Suwede n’abandi baturage ku byaha byibasiye amategeko mpuzamahanga akorerwa mu mahanga.
mt0: <pad> Sweden's law permits prosecution of citizens and other residents for international criminal offences committed abroad.</s>

en: Some information for this report came from The Associated Press, Reuters and Agence France-Presse.
kin: Amakuru amwe n'amwe yaturutse muri Associated Press, Reuters na Agence France-Presse.
mt0: <pad> Some of the news came from the Associated Press, Reuters and Agence France-Presse.</s>

en: Erdogan Goes to Riyadh to Seal Rapprochement
kin: Erdogan Yagiye Riyadh Kashe Kwiyegereza
mt0: <pad> Erdogan went to Riyadh to strengthen ties with Saudi Arabia.</s>

en: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan heads to Saudi Arabia Thursday for a two-day visit aimed at easing old tensions between Ankara and Riyadh.
kin: Ku wa kane, Perezida wa Turkiya, Recep Tayyip Erdogan yerekeje muri Arabiya Sawudite mu ruzinduko rw’iminsi ibiri rugamije kugabanya amakimbirane ashaje hagati ya Ankara na Riyadh.
mt0: <pad> On Thursday, Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan headed to Saudi Arabia on a two-day visit aimed at reassuring the tense relations between Ankara and Riyadh.</s>

en: The Turkish leaders visit with the Saudi king comes after years of rivalry between their once-close countries.
kin: Abayobozi ba Turukiya basuye n’umwami wa Arabiya Sawudite bije nyuma y’imyaka myinshi bahanganye hagati y’ibihugu byabo byahoze.
mt0: <pad> Turkish officials met with the king of Saudi Arabia after years of conflict.</s>

en: Mehmet Ogutcu is the head of the London Energy Club, a grouping of government and energy sector leaders. Ogutcu says the visit is the culmination of intense international diplomacy.
kin: Mehmet Ogutcu ni umuyobozi wa Club y’ingufu za Londres, itsinda ry’abayobozi ba guverinoma n’ingufu. Ogutcu avuga ko uruzinduko ari indunduro ya diplomasi mpuzamahanga.
mt0: <pad> Mehmet Ogutcu is the president of the London Power Club, a group of government and power. Ogutcu says the visit is the start of international diplomacy.</s>

en: "President Erdogan has good relations with the king; with the crown prince Muhammad Bin Salman, we had serious difficulties," said Ogutcu. "Now it looks that I believe the*(Britons), and Americans, and the Qataris of course played some role, even the Azeris might have done this. And things are changing and relaxing a bit more, and now at the presidential level, it's going to be sealed."
kin: Ogutcu ati: "Perezida Erdogan afitanye umubano mwiza n'umwami; n'umutware w'ikamba Muhammad Bin Salman, twagize ibibazo bikomeye". "Noneho birasa nkaho nizera * (Abongereza), n'Abanyamerika, ndetse na Qatar birumvikana ko hari uruhare bagize, ndetse n'abanya Azerisitani bashobora kuba barabikoze. Kandi ibintu birahinduka kandi biruhura gato, none kurwego rwa perezida, bigiye gushyirwaho kashe. "
mt0: <pad> Ogutcu said: "President Erdogan has a good relationship with the king; and the head of the palace Muhammad Bin Salman, we had difficult problems. Now I think I believe * (British), and the Americans, and Qatar, and it is clear that there was some involvement, and now at the level of the president, it should be put to an end.</s>

en: Erdogan and the crown prince have been bitter rivals. The Turkish president led international condemnation over the murder of Saudi journalist Jamal Khashoggi, who was killed inside Saudi Arabias consulate in Istanbul.
kin: Erdogan n'umutware w'ikamba babaye abanywanyi bakaze. Perezida wa Turkiya yamaganye amahanga kubera iyicwa ry'umunyamakuru wa Arabiya Sawudite, Jamal Khashoggi, yiciwe muri konsuline ya Arabiya Sawudite i Istanbul.
mt0: <pad> Erdogan and the head of the team became close friends.</s>

en: The killing was linked to the crown prince, a charge he denied. But the decision earlier this month to move the Khashoggi murder trial from Istanbul to Riyadh is seen as a gesture by Ankara, opening the way for Erdogan's visit.
kin: Ubwicanyi bwari bufitanye isano nigikomangoma, ikirego arabihakana. Ariko icyemezo cyatangiye muri uku kwezi cyo kwimura urubanza rw’ubwicanyi rwa Khashoggi kuva Istambul kugera i Riyadh gifatwa nk’ikimenyetso cya Ankara, kikaba cyarafunguye inzira y'uruzinduko rwa Erdogan.
mt0: <pad> The murder was linked to the prince, the charge he denies. But the decision this month to move the trial of Khashoggi from Istanbul to Riyadh is seen as a sign by Ankara, opening the way for Erdogan's visit.</s>

en: Ogutcu says with presidential elections due next year, Erdogan is looking for Saudi help to bail out the ailing Turkish economy.
kin: Ogutcu avuga ko hamwe n'amatora ya perezida ateganijwe umwaka utaha, Erdogan arimo gushaka ubufasha bwa Arabiya Sawudite kugira ngo akize ubukungu bwa Turukiya burwaye.
mt0: <pad> Ogutcu says that with the upcoming presidential election, Erdogan is seeking Saudi Arabia's help to revive the Turkish economy which is in a bad state.</s>

en: "Turkey has an interest in reviving relations with Riyadh because Turkey needs financial support," said Ogutcu. "The Turkish economy is not attracting any significant portfolio investments nor sovereign wealth funds coming to invest Turkey. But this will be a give-and-take package deal involving these countries. So, there are real economic and political security interests involved."
kin: Ogutcu ati: "Turkiya ishishikajwe no kongera umubano na Riyadh kuko Turukiya ikeneye inkunga y'amafaranga". "Ubukungu bwa Turukiya ntabwo bukurura ishoramari rikomeye cyangwa amafaranga y’umutungo wigenga uza gushora Turukiya. Ariko aya azaba amasezerano yo gutanga no gufata ibyemezo birimo ibi bihugu. Ku bw'ibyo, hari inyungu z’ubukungu n’ubukungu bya politiki zirimo."
mt0: <pad> Ogutcu said: "Turkey is interested in strengthening its ties with Riyadh because the Turkish economy does not cover large investment or private capital to invest in Turkey. But this will require agreements to provide and take decisions which include these countries. Therefore, there are economic and political economic interests involved."</s>

en: Shared concerns over Iran's growing influence in the region -- along with its nuclear energy program -- provide important common ground between Riyadh and Ankara, says international relations professor Soli Ozel of Istanbul's Kadir Has University, especially as American attention is expected to pivot away from the Middle East and toward China.
kin: Umwarimu w’umubano mpuzamahanga, Soli Ozel wo muri kaminuza ya Kadir Has ya kaminuza ya Istanbul, avuga ko impungenge z’uko Irani igenda yiyongera muri kariya karere - hamwe na gahunda yayo y’ingufu za kirimbuzi - bitanga icyerekezo rusange hagati ya Riyadh na Ankara. Uburasirazuba bwo hagati no mu Bushinwa.
mt0: <pad> The concerns about Iran's growing influence in the region - and its nuclear program - provide a common direction between Riyadh and Ankara.</s>

en: "Turkey does propose itself as a counterweight to Iran. Both countries have an interest along with all the western countries for Iran not to be as influential throughout the region as it is today," said Ozel. "And the Iranians are also constantly sending signals that they are not going to let others draw them away from those countries - Iraq, Lebanon and Syria - where they have quite a lot of influence."
kin: Ozel yagize ati: "Turukiya yiyerekana nk'ikibazo cyo guhangana na Irani. Ibihugu byombi bifite inyungu hamwe n'ibihugu byose byo mu burengerazuba bw'isi kugira ngo Irani itagira uruhare runini mu karere nk'uko bimeze ubu." "Kandi Abanyayirani nabo bahora bohereza ibimenyetso byerekana ko batazemera ko abandi babavana muri ibyo bihugu - Iraki, Libani na Siriya - aho bafite uruhare runini."
mt0: <pad> Ozel said: "Turkey is a problem to Iran. Both countries have an interest in preventing Iran from having a large influence in the region as it is now."</s>

en: Erdogan's Saudi visit is part of a wider policy of seeking to repair relations across the region in a bid to end its isolation. The Turkish president has recently visited the United Arab Emirates and earlier this month hosted the Israeli president, Isaac Herzog.
kin: Uruzinduko rwa Erdogan muri Arabiya Sawudite ni imwe muri politiki yagutse yo gusana umubano mu karere kose hagamijwe guhagarika akato. Perezida wa Turukiya aherutse gusura Leta zunze ubumwe z'Abarabu kandi mu ntangiriro z'uku kwezi yakiriye perezida wa Isiraheli, Isaac Herzog.
mt0: <pad> The visit of Erdogan to Saudi Arabia is part of a wider policy of re-establishing relations with the region in order to end the sanctions. The Turkish president has recently visited the United Arab Emirates and in the beginning of this month he hosted the Israeli president, Isaac Herzog.</s>

en: But analyst Ozel warns Ankara is in a vulnerable position.
kin: Ariko umusesenguzi Ozel aragabisha Ankara ari mu bihe bigoye.
mt0: <pad> But analyst Ozel warns that Ankara is in difficult times.</s>

en: "Turkey alienated, insulted, offended a lot of countries with which it had at least decent relations. And they all recognize that this burst of diplomacy is coming out of weakness rather than strength," said Ozel.
kin: Ozel yagize ati: "Turukiya yitandukanyije, iratukwa, ibabaza ibihugu byinshi byari bifitanye nibura n'imibanire myiza. Kandi bose baremera ko uku guturika kwa diplomasi biva mu ntege nke aho gukomera."
mt0: <pad> Ozel said: "Turkey isolated itself, rejected, angered many countries that had at least good relations. And everyone agrees that this diplomacy explosion comes from weakness rather than strength."</s>

en: But analysts say Ankara is banking on its importance as a potential bulwark to Iranian ambitions, a factor that may help overcome any remaining hostility among the neighbors it is trying to win back.
kin: Ariko abasesenguzi bavuga ko Ankara ari banki ku kamaro kayo nk’igihome gikomeye cyo kwifuza kwa Irani, kikaba ari ikintu gishobora gufasha gutsinda inzangano zisigaye mu baturanyi igerageza gutsinda.
mt0: <pad> But analysts say that Ankara is bank on its own as a strong leverage of Iran's wishes, something that can help overcome the rest of the regional rivalries it is trying to overcome.</s>

en: Executions, Detentions Hang Over Saudi Legal Reforms
kin: Iyicwa, Gufungwa bamanitse Kuvugurura Amategeko yo muri Arabiya Sawudite
mt0: <pad> The killing, imprisonment and reform of Saudi Arabian law</s>

en: Saudi Arabia is pushing to revamp its harsh justice system but reforms are overshadowed by executions and tough treatment of dissidents, raising questions about how much will change.
kin: Arabiya Sawudite irihatira kuvugurura imikorere y’ubutabera ikarishye ariko ivugurura rirengerwa n’iyicwa ndetse n’ifatwa rikomeye ry’abatavuga rumwe n’ubutegetsi, bitera kwibaza niba byinshi bizahinduka.
mt0: <pad> Saudi Arabia is trying to reform its harsh judiciary system but the reform is obscured by the killing and severe detention of dissidents, which raises the question whether much will change.</s>

en: The kingdom is known for its strict interpretation of Islamic sharia law, which forms the basis of its judicial system.
kin: Ubwami buzwiho gusobanura byimazeyo amategeko ya shariya ya kisilamu, agize ishingiro ryubucamanza.
mt0: <pad> The kingdom is known to interpret the Sharia law of Islam in its most strict form, which forms the basis of the judiciary system.</s>

en: But in recent months it has moved ahead with reforms that analysts say could make its courts function more like others in the Middle East.
kin: Ariko mu mezi ashize yateye imbere hamwe n'ivugurura abasesenguzi bavuga ko rishobora gutuma inkiko zayo zikora nk'abandi bo mu burasirazuba bwo hagati.
mt0: <pad> But in recent months it has advanced with reforms that some commentators say may make its courts work like other Middle East courts.</s>

en: That effort hinges on a series of new laws for sensitive issues like women's divorce rights and judges' power to determine criminal sentences.
kin: Iyo mbaraga ishingiye ku ruhererekane rw'amategeko mashya ku bibazo byoroshye nk'uburenganzira bwo gutandukana kw'abagore n'ububasha bw'abacamanza bwo kumenya ibihano.
mt0: <pad> The power is based on a series of new laws on simple issues like women's right to divorce and the power of judges to decide punishments.</s>

en: Announced last year by de facto ruler Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman, the measures, including the first written penal code, appear to align with Saudi Arabia's goal of opening up to the world and softening its extremist image.
kin: Byatangajwe umwaka ushize n’umutegetsi w’ikirenga, igikomangoma, Mohammed bin Salman, ingamba, harimo n’igitabo cya mbere cy’amategeko ahana, bigaragara ko zihuye n’intego ya Arabiya Sawudite yo gukingura isi no koroshya isura y’intagondwa.
mt0: <pad> Announced last year by the top official, Prince Mohammed bin Salman, the measures, including the first criminal code, seem to be in line with Saudi Arabia's goal of opening the world and softening the image of extremism.</s>

en: Even critics concede the changes could make Saudi courts more predictable, in some cases.
kin: Ndetse n'abanenga bemeza ko impinduka zishobora gutuma inkiko zo muri Arabiya Sawudite zishobora guhanurwa, mu bihe bimwe na bimwe.
mt0: <pad> Even analysts agree that the impact of these changes could lead to Saudi Arabia's judiciary being overhauled, at times.</s>

en: But there is no expectation that restrictions on free speech will ease, or that the legal system will treat more favorably perceived opponents of the government.

mt0: <pad> But don't expect that censorship will ease, or that the law will treat opposition with respect.</s>

en: And despite the reforms, authorities have simultaneously provided reminders of what gave Saudi Arabia its ruthless reputation in the first place, notably the mass execution of 81 men in a single day in March for offenses related to "terrorism."
